SwiwvVqxiDt7f-uqXAcwfA.text: Such a simple breakfast, but so so good! Came here the morning after landing in London and was pleasantly surprised. My boyfriend and I arrived slightly past 8am on a Saturday morning, but there was already a short line. The place is CASH ONLY, so be sure to have some on hand. While in line, we started chatting with a frequent customer here who recommended a couple of typical English breakfast items that were good here. Bubble and Hash which is basically mashed potatoes with cabbage and black pudding which is basically blood sausage. Although black pudding doesn't necessarily sound appealing, it was actually very good as was everything else. We both got the breakfast deal which included bacon, eggs, toast, choice of beans or grilled tomatoes, and choice of tea or coffee and added all of the extras to share including hashbrown, mushroom, bubble and hash and the black pudding. The breakfast was so simple, affordable and delicious that we made it back here TWICE during our 4 day stay in London. Definitely recommend!

B6Bjl2QBpyn-iIQ3hNbF7A.text: I'd heard a lot of good things about Regency Cafe, enough so that I made it a priority to go during our London trip.  We chose a morning when we had a Buckingham Palace State Rooms tour planned since the cafe was roughly in the vicinity.  Yes, there was a line, but it moved quickly.  The small woman with the loud voice wasn't there, but the owner was, a very pleasant if rather no-nonsense guy.  We got our two set breakfasts, one without eggs but with toast, the other with hash browns and bread.  The slabs of buttered bread were ENORMOUS; I couldn't even begin to finish them even though they were very tasty.  I love English breakfasts so I enjoyed the food, but if I must be honest I had just as good food in other places.  If I were staying in the area I'd be hitting it up every day.  If you're not in that area, though, there's no need to go out of your way for it.

nrY2N_zZ7n_vv1Wlk7JMSw.text: Proper greasy spoon breakfast hidden away in Westminster (tables and chairs bolted to the floor and everything).Great value, tasty food.

KpBUDOJF0cvMEwaIsEluUw.text: The real diner experience. IN LONDON. Basic simple place, don't expect grandeur, but good food and best bang for your buck this place has. MASSIVE meal sizes for wee prices. Most impressive thing about this place? The lady who takes your order's VOICE! Loudest voice ever that booms like a projected announcement for the whole world to hear (Necessary, when it's bustling and for you to hear your order is ready over the surrounding conversations and noise). Once you get used to that, you won't get distracted from your food and won't have to halt your conversations with others anymore. Note this place only takes cash!

N1GHiCy5hoEg1CflUnrSzg.text: Having worked a short walk away from The Regency for over 7 years you'd think that I would've been here more than twice...but you'd be wrong. Today was my second visit to this brilliant cafe. A cafe so brilliant that you have to get her well before 12 to miss out on the massive queue out the door.We arrived around 11:50 and had to wait about 20 mins to order out food. The rule is that you order before you sit down and this rule keeps the tables ticking over nicely.The lovely lady at the counter is a bit Jekkyl and Hyde... Very polite and softly spoken as you're ordering but a booming "builders cafe" voice when calling out the orders ready to be collected. This all adds to the great, bustling atmosphere.One this occasion I opted for the Set Breakfast (egg, 2 bacon, sausage, a choice of beans or tomatoes, a choice of bread or toast and a choice of tea or coffee) with beans, bread, extra hash browns and black pudding and a cup of tea. I was disappointed that I had arrived too late for the bubble and squeak. All meals are customisable for a price so you can pretty much combine most things on the menu as far as I can see. It took less than 10 minutes before I heard "Set, beans, hash browns and black pudding" hollered from the countered and I was sat down demolishing a brilliant all day breakfast. All the ingredients are high quality, nothing tastes cheap and you're guaranteed a full belly at the end of it.I will always come back to The Regency. It may take me 4 or 5 years between visits but I love it today as much as the first time I went.Oh, and did I mention that a rather famous scene from the film Layer Cake with Daniel Craig was filmed in there...?

Snt4EwhgErWh0AmVsgn8Wg.text: Has every right to be considered an institution.It's one of London's most famous restaurants yet seems to refuse to cater to the hype.  Excellent food made with *love* with a truly authentic atmosphere.  Avoid prime meal times to avoid frustratingly long lines.  One star off as they don't honor requests for the eggs to be cooked scrambled (this is the only way I eat eggs, and Ive never heard a restaurant downright refuse to make them this way.)A must-do in the West End!

Eut4EwQOS6jTNnyJS-yCHg.text: Hearty meal, no nonsense. Yummy and filling!

AqQlwUxwVSM73ZlZXN20-Q.text: Finally! I've had Regency Cafe on my bookmark list for ages, but since it closes at 12 on the weekends and I like to sleep in, it hasn't happened... until now and boy is it worth it.I can understand the 12:00 close for breakfast. They seem to have a constant queue of customers craving an English brekkie and have it timed perfectly as they seem to run out of food at just about noon. Upon arrival, the queue seems a bit intimidating, but it's one of the most efficient queues I've seen in London. The main guy takes your order, fixes your drinks and makes the toast while also yelling out orders for pick up and doesn't miss a beat. He knows exactly who's ordered what and obviously has rapport with repeat customers. If you're a local, it's the place you want to be on a Saturday morning.And then there's the food. It's simple, but it's delicious. I had 2 eggs over easy on 2 toasts plus sausage and hash browns.... REAL hash browns, not potatoes, hash browns. Hit the spot, perfect fry up, and definitely worth waking up early for.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

hc5b0CLi7H08-nFUMB3jhg.text: The quintessential English cafe - perfect.Traditional cafes are a dying breed, all too often shunned in favour of a chain coffee house churning out lattes and pastry. It's a real shame as when they are this good they surpass any other breakfast on offer. For six quid the full English, complete with bacon, sausages, egg, beans, tea/coffee and bread/toast is out of this world. I'd recommend adding the homemade hash browns for an additional 90p. As in all traditional cafes the coffee is crap so stick with the tea.We were so stuffed afterwards that we had to walk our bikes for half hour before cycling back across town. I'm still full now 4 hours later!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. My mate Pottsy
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Amazing amount of food for 6.40

6wuX1jo2QywsveD7rNWxDA.text: More happening than the great revenge scene in Layer Cake - solid fuel for working people. Had no issue navigating the engaging cafeteria ordering scheme - it was a great experience and the food was on point. Orange yolks are signs of quality sourcing! Well worth navigating to when in town.

mf9DCQSFRqffOjoZfu31JA.text: This is the UK version of the Seinfeld's Soup Nazi. The queue is out the door, everyone knows the process, and no matter how hard you studied the tips on yelp, you feel the pressure of having your S@&! together by the time you reach the counter. Organized chaos. As you wait in the queue rehearsing your order in your head, you look around and people watch, and you can't help but think, why doesn't he just ask for your name like Starbucks ? Moreover, you start thinking, how am I going to get a table for 8? Somehow, it just happens. The micromanaging type A behind the counter is making it work. Mushroom and onion pie with beans and chips were our orders. Kids ordered spaghetti bolognese. Family was happy and it was the perfect place for our first meal in the UK. Arriving at 12:30 was rush hour, but by the time we left at 2, you could have your choice of seats. Yes, even the one where Daniel Craig filmed his role.  If you have that friend who takes forever to order, this place is not for them. If you want to Baptize your way into the British cuisine, this place is a must. Great to pop our cherry, First Meal in UK.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Queue out the door at 12-1:30
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Classic British  !

ydxiBg4cBUa4WBTnAM-rcw.text: This place is an absolute gem.In the last two weeks my colleagues and I have been in here five times, and are gradually working our way through the menu!The breakfasts are great as you would expect as are the puddings.Today as it's Friday we decided to go for fish and chips. It was 10.45am but who cares!Now normally I am slightly cautious about ordering things like fish and chips from a cafe ie not a chippy but this place is something else. It was honestly some of the best cod I have ever tasted, so fresh and perfectly white. Very good.The place has a wide spectrum of customers including tradesmen, office guys and the odd tourist who has read about it.The prices are freakishly low and the service is friendly and efficient. These guys seriously know what they are doing!If you have any sense give your usual boring chain coffee shop a miss and come here!

8IdtvEgmk4DGpJXEuHJ7-g.text: Tourists!  Here is the system at Regency Cafe (from the viewpoint of another tourist):1.  Wait in line.  Don't worry, it will go fast.  Also, while waiting in line, do not worry if you don't see an open table.  There will be an open table by the time you order.2.  Order from the person at the counter.  You should probably order the set breakfast.  If you do so, you will have three choices: (1) coffee or tea; (2) beans or tomato; and (3) bread or toast.  You also have the option of adding on hash browns, bubble and squeak (basically hash browns with additional vegetables), or black pudding (you don't want to know, but you should be eating it).  If it's Friday, consider the fish and chips.3.  Pay the person.  In cash.4.  You get your coffee or tea right at the counter.  There are also napkins on the counter.  There is silverware in the tray to the left.5.  Find a table.  I told you there would be an open one.6.  Admire the old school ambiance.  British Vogue loves to shoot here.  There are pictures to prove it.  Read testimonials from fancy chefs who sing the praises of Regency Cafe.7.  Check out the patrons here, who are from all walks of life.  Regulars, tourists, blue and white collar.  Even the fancy ladies of Burberry headquarters, a block away, can be spotted here.  Probably hungover.  But wearing badass shoes.8.  If you ordered toast, this comes out first.  The person at the counter will bellow when the toast is ready.  Her voice is loud.  You should hear it.  Walk up and get it.9.  Likewise, when your food is ready, the person at the counter will yell out your order.  In the US, the person taking the order usually yells out the order to the cooks; not so here.  Here, the yelling is directed to the customer to get their food.  Your food will be distinguished by whether you chose beans or tomato, and whether you added anything on (e.g., "SET BREAKFAST, BEANS, BLACK PUDDING!!!").  Walk up and get it.10.  Eat.  Happily.11.  Trundle home and take a very satisfying nap.12.  (Optional) Write a Yelp review.

LoeZk58tZQqqIq8FDuscSw.text: This is the place to go for breakfast, especially if you are coming in or out of Victoria Station. Was visiting London for a day and found this place since it was close and was pleasantly surprised upon entering to find a wonderful atmosphere. The menu was wonderfully priced (for London that is) and all the food was amazing. I got the traditional English Breakfast for about 5 pounds and fifty pence which included baked beans, an egg, sausage, bacon, tea, and toast. Then I also got three hash browns for an extra 90 pence (which were definitely worth it!). I am definitely making a point to come here next time I can get to London!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Storefront
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. 5.50 includes bacon, sausage, beans, and egg (Tea n' toast not pictured). Hashbrowns are an extra 90 pence and a must.
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Full English Breakfast for two complete with Earl Grey tea

sRYHnMGPMzoWBx3p5tzBEQ.text: There can be a long queue at Regency Cafe sometimes, but the line moves pretty quickly. You can also take the opportunity to see what's on the menu while waiting in line. There is a lot of variety here, from hearty English breakfast foods to small snacks to lunch meals. I waited about ten minutes in line, and ordered the sausage egg and chips meal.( As a potato enthusiast, chips are an absolute must for me when it's on the menu) My food came out in less than five minutes, and everything was hot to the touch! Tables are immediately bussed after people leave, making seating inside a lot quicker and easier.  The food was great; portions were huge and I definitely left with my stomach full and satisfied :)

lXC17wdZu-hg0wDaBYySvw.text: Staying about a block away, this is the sort of spot you hope to find on holiday. It has a very local vibe and ordering can be intimidating, but I felt it added to the charm of the place. We got the "set" breakfast, traditional English. Everything was spot on. Going tomorrow for the pie.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

1oMQtvqRcVDwt2pbRQ6Uzw.text: So this place is one of those joints that when you are walking by, you see a line out the door. It's an incredible experience with great breakfast food and the line didn't take too long. Also, the lady who runs the place has the biggest voice I've ever heard. Go just to hear her call out your food.

RMgXggyRv6IKtcGJnQe0ag.text: YES! Go here, breakfast is good, not too expensive and did I mention it was good? If you're in London, go to Regency Cafe, have breakfast and walk it off to the typical London attractions which are a fee minutes from Regency Cafe.The place is small, so be ready to wait for a table if it's full. I got there and ordered the full English breakfast, there were some tables open, as soon as I got my breakfast it started to get packed.I would love to go back and have more breakfast at this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Full English breakfast with hash browns and black pudding added, those are extras.

Zj1fdv8YsY5HmG3ecgUesg.text: The main woman here had the loudest, most impressive calling out voice I have ever heard. You have to hear it to believe it and it's worth going for this alone. Went here with a big group of colleagues for breakfast the other day and can say that this place is probably best suited to smaller groups of 2-4 since the tables are all fixed in place and you can't move them together. But still had a good time and the place had the right sort of good morning non-nonsense vibe to start the day off right.What everyone else days is also true: HUGE portions of unhealthy food, reasonable prices, really fast service. Not quite sure why this place is so popular (and had no idea it was a tourist spot??) but it does have some sort of je ne sais quois that makes it special.

M1sbMB4OMr5ttSfsU7mkZg.text: I almost have no words to describe how good this English breakfast is. we walk in, and the place is full of cops eating breakfast..a good sign! a full breakfast is around 7 pounds and we paid extra for hash browns (worth it). get your coffee and toast before you sit and make sure you pay attention and get your food when it's called, it comes out quick! you must go here for English breakfast, more than once if you can. If I ever return to London, this will be my first stop.

0_jRV5JgLL-v1Xx1ZHOcbg.text: I always wanted to go to this cafe because of the movie Layer Cake(what an underrated movie). Nevertheless get there early(but there will still be a line). We got there about 9 and by the time we left at 10:30 the line was atleast 50 people deep OUTSIDE. The line inside moves  quickly and I was impressed that the small staff handled so many people so efficiently. The man who was the manager/order taker/owner was so impressive with how he was so fast yet so kind when it came to ordering. The breakfast was so good! I will certainly everytime I come to London go to the Regency Cafe for breakfast. P.S. It is not that far(walking distance) from MI6.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

W8mGDDSObxCHg4gf7pjd4w.text: This place is the place to get a proper English breakfast! It's affordable and close by to Buckingham Palace. So if you decide to visit the Palace you might as well stop here for breakfast.  A breakfast special included 1 egg, 1 sausage, 2 bacon slices; a choice of tomatoes or baked beans, toast or bread and tea or coffee! I opted for baked beans, toast and tea! It was so freaken good! I added hash browns for 90 pence and blood sausage for another 90 pence. In all my boyfriend and I spent 15 pounds for breakfast! This is practically a steal! The interior has a retro dinner feel and lots of locals come to this diner. The owner was nice and the food came out quick. Tip: order first and pick up your own food. Free seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. 1 egg, 1 sausage, 2 bacon, baked beans, hash browns and blood sausage.
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Proper English brekkie

wafuao6jdsaWc5nG3vrtSA.text: First the loooong line, then the rush to put in orders, then the search for an open table, then the unbelievable timely freeing up of a table, then the loud yell to come get your order ...and then the prize - huge portions, just as you like it, very tasty and satisfying breakfast ...All worth it ...Loved it! And note, this place is cash only!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Eggs, sausage, mushrooms, chips, beans on the bottom, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, tomatoes, mushrooms, beans on top

tGlR4H7r49q0zxGkbzo6Rg.text: Delicious full set breakfast - super cheap. Fun local neighborhood and a very welcoming host/owner. This is a MUST go if you are in London. You won't find a better full English breakfast anywhere - especially not for £5.50!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

RXr-ZT67YxNjTArSdIuNKQ.text: This was our first time in London so we wanted to try out some fish and chips. It was amazing. Fresh cod and the fries were good. We also had the breakfast plate which was pretty tasty. Great tea. Although the line was long it went by pretty quickly

G2vyRMUPjgb2PQ8VNYXcGQ.text: If you're visiting London, you NEED to stop and eat at Regency Cafe for brunch! I'm not a local, but I wanted to try this place after reading all the reviews raving about this "authentic London institution." I couldn't agree more!The line was out the door, but moved quickly. The older man at the register was taking orders, cashiering money, expediting food, and pouring coffee all at once! He even called out our orders by name! Even though the environment seemed rushed, he was still attentive enough to make sure I got my toast, coffee, and juice :)I split the full English breakfast (7 pounds) with an extra order of hashbrowns, bubble & squeak, and orange juice! I'm American so I've never tried bubble and squeak before (baked potatoes with onions in cream?), but it was pretty bland and heavy. The sausage was really yummy though, not too fatty--and I'm not even a fan of sausage. The bacon was salty, but it tasted good with the soft egg and crispy hashbrowns.It's also walking distance from London Victoria train station!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Everything was delicious, but you NEED to try the fresh orange juice and homemade sausage!

1iaf2kUZVZucuw6V29HF1w.text: When we decided to visit London, we decided to see the sights and not plan any meals - instead, we would simply consult Yelp when our stomachs started growling, and take our chances.  And that's how we wound up at the Regency Cafe.  I love diners, and Regency Cafe was exactly what I wanted.  A diamond in the rough, a great little art deco cafe in what appeared to be the middle of nowhere.  I ordered the standard English breakfast with eggs, beans, peas, bacon and toast.  Although the bacon was a little on the salty side, eating it with the toast solved that problem.  It's difficult to screw up an English breakfast, so it would be unusual for someone to make it great or to fail at it, so what makes the breakfast at Regency Cafe worth it is the atmosphere.  First, there's Marco shouting out everyone's name to pick up their food from the counter.  Then there's all the photos of Tottenham Hotspur players on the wall, but I let that slide since they have just as many Muhammad Ali photos on the wall too.  It wasn't too crowded when we ate mid-morning, so there was no difficulty finding a booth and getting great service.  The crowd consisted of some business folks, a few construction workers, and some regular joes having breakfast.  Since I love diners, I thought it just reminded me of other 50's era diners from the U.S.  Then a few days later, our cabbie told us the movie "Layer Cake" was filmed there.  Of course - a pivotal scene from that movie just made it more awesome!  We didn't have time to visit a second time, even though we tried, but I made sure to rent Layer Cake when we arrived home so I could relive a great breakfast at Regency Cafe.

NTBwETE4xAozcPsT69w-rg.text: I am constantly looking for reputable places to eat especially now that my parents are here visiting. This restaurant was close to their hotel in Pimlico, plus gave us the ultimate English Breakfast! Between the three of us, we got two breakfasts, and my dad (who is super picky and insisting we only eat fruit), loved the experience and food.Our total was 13.25 (ordered an extra drink and had a tailored vegetarian plate), so for less than £5 per head you get a very satisfactory breakfast. I give four stars as the food and coffees/teas were bog standard. This is definitely a great staple restaurant.Note: construction is being done on the pavement right outside the restaurant; if you want some tranquility, or even a warm, bustling atmosphere, this is not the place at the moment!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Veggie breakfast: roasted tomatoes, baked beans, hash brown, mushroom, bubble and squeak, and of course a fried egg!

vpzMX8pofleDeToWH8pMpw.text: I will never look at breakfast the same again. Top notch at a low price. The only other breakfast I've had that beat this one cost x10 the price (not exaggerating!)

Uk15HqNnvuP2IA-UnST6Rg.text: Highly recommend Regency Café! The service was EXCEPTIONAL! I was visiting from California and I wanted to try something new which he was a little worried I may not like because American corn beef isn't the same. I ordered the set breakfast with a half side of corn beef. When I was served they made it exactly how I imagined it in my head lol. Everything we had was delicious and their orange juice, is a must have.

zvOfNbQ4vYe1AsyRSw7poQ.text: **Tip: CASH ONLY!**Definitely a must-see if you're in London! A classic British breakfast experience, featuring: charming diner atmosphere, long but fast-moving lines, cheap and large portions, and a woman behind the counter with the most impressive booming voice shouting out orders. You can eat a full British breakfast for just around 5 pounds - definitely a steal. I recommend adding on hashbrowns and bubble & squeak (vegetable mash). Don't be disheartened by the long lines -- it moves quickly!

-6cpQQaExYXTOY-bHOxCbA.text: Husband and I went here for a quick breakfast during our trip to London. Such great food and the prices cannot be beat. With much research we always made it in early to beat the crowds. We changed it up a bit every time we ordered and so far most items on the breakfast menu was amazing. Try out that orange juice in the glass bottle. It's delicious.

AhQJVxpo7bLydrxTTM7SVw.text: A neighborhood gem of a diner stuck in the 60's and 70's. And that's a good thing! Feels like a place that Rocky Balboa would feel very comfortable in. No nonsense menu, but also friendly to tourists. I feel as if I finally had an authentic English breakfast here. Had the set deal of the day... 1 sausage, 2 bacon, 1 sausage, tomatoes (or beans), toast (or bread), and tea (or coffee) for 5.50. Not bad at all. And bubble &squeak for 90p on the side. Seems like a good deal for 6.40 pounds.Highly recommend. Cash only, as previously mentioned and no wifi.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

QbPubNaTld8AgvLaBCovGg.text: We came here just right before the lunch crowd so we're able to get a table in a few minutes right after we order.They have quite an extensive menu ranging from breakfast to daily specials. We've all ordered the full English breakfast set at £5.50, a pretty good value consisting of two toasts with butter, two pieces of bacon, baked beans, sausage and a fried egg. Hash browns are add-ons. This place is different from any of the other usual cafes. They are not packed with tourists only but a good balance of locals too.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

cwdVda4qASq6kbhrme0NcA.text: Excellent full English breakfast at unbelievable prices. Make sure you know what you want to order when you reach the counter. This is a no nonsense cafe that is run with military-like precision. We loved our breakfast and we found the cafe absolutely charming.

X-ismWbi5ncY1SzQbRDAMQ.text: An english breakfast at The Regency is a quintessential london experience.  We came here on our last day in London, and we were so happy that we saved it until the end of our trip.. The ordering experience is different than anything we've ever experienced in North America.  There was a lady who single handling was in charge of the whole restaurant.  She was so efficient in working with the kitchen to get the food out to the customers as quickly as possible.  The diners were locals, the vibe was cool.  For food, we had the broiled tomatoes, hash browns, sausage and bacon.  The only complaint was that the food was a bit salty, but other than that it was delicious.A trip to London wouldn't be complete without coming here, we enjoyed our entire experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Set Breakfast

Bm7X5CESV0XTL5sxRfhDiw.text: Very popular, cash only, and inexpensive.  Order first, then choose a seat.  We stood outside because the line was so long, but it was worth the wait.  The food was cooked quickly and the staff was great.  The curry was great (make sure to eat it with mango chutney!), burgers fresh, and "pasty" was light and flaky.  Go there!

MSUHJkXdzG_mdfxM8f10cw.text: This place is the real deal.Massive quantities of food at a low price.  Piping hot hash browns, full mugs of coffee, more baked beans than you can finish in one sitting.  The decor is vintage and lovely.  The waitstaff are caricatures in themselves, friendly and sharp at the same time.As another reviewer mentioned: order at the register, get a seat, and wait for your order to be called.  If you're not sure if it's yours, just go up and ask!This is a great London scene and great food, not to be missed!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast is served!

PMVrAselHbdSs6-nUr3Mdg.text: My fiancée and I were very lucky to be staying close by to this place. And since our dollar doesn't go very far here, we were very happy about the wallet-friendly prices they had here. We knew it had to be good when we walked in. Local people everywhere: cops and construction workers abound. The man at the register was quite friendly and the food -- the full English breakfast with hash browns was something I'll never forget. I try to make it back home now but you better bet that when we return to London we'll back!!

I6G2sOYF5nXUqqfiP_PyDA.text: Has the classic diner and greasy feel, coupled with good eats.  I had the set English breakfast with black pudding.  The baked beans were delicious and the black pudding, to my surprise, was on the money - crisp on the outside and not too strong of a flavor.  It was only £5.50 plus £0.90 for the black pudding and it included either a coffee or tea.  My favorite part, aside from the food, is the feel of the shop!  The cashier is a really friendly person with a loud voice.  It makes for an enjoyable experience and definitely authentic diner restaurant.  Enjoy!

EbEyIhK8g3akek2F5so0mg.text: Really really friendly and helpful staff and yummy food, even for vegetarians!  I am very happy we went here. (Cash only, no bathroom.)

Yp6NtXpy6hCNZYolno3mHg.text: We had a full English breakfast at Regency Cafe this morning. The cashier wasn't as brusque / mean as Yelp reviews led me to believe, but he did raise an eyebrow when we ordered to go because we were running late to get to Westminster Abbey. I didn't get the near-religious fervor that seemed to surround this place; the food was just okay, as expected. It wasn't bad for what it was, but there's only so much one can do with bacon (not the thinly fried slices we're used to) and beans. I ordered a side of black pudding as well, which was okay.

GsedcmkUkNpqukfzx3DxxQ.text: Great breakfast deal and the most perfectly cooked eggs I've ever had.  Delicious all around, and I wish I could have eaten here every morning.  Make sure to order first, THEN sit back and enjoy your delicious English breakfast amongst the businessmen, local police, construction workers, and students.Not sure why it keeps being referred to as a greasy spoon.  This is not your Phillips 66 gas station diner.  I've eaten at my share of greasy spoons in the states and unlike those diners, Regency's food has finesse.  The eggs were prepared so perfectly and delicately I could've photographed them for Food & Wine.  The wheat bread was so fresh and grainy, I could've eaten the entire loaf by myself and had my boyfriend roll me home.

B6b0wa13DVlyfTz039m4DA.text: No frills, working class cafe. Just good food and BOLD service. You'll have to go here to see what I mean about that. :)

LvoaUX0yxAJCWIVtshiX1g.text: Delicious local place in London. Good coffee and delicious chips! Omlette was also good!

0XvjLNzYeAh8qyCP8LZ4PA.text: looking for a place for breakfast? this is THE place.we had a very traditional English breakfast - eggs, sausage, toast, coffee, bacon for two only £10. We wait about 20 minutes on the line and it was worthy! Marco, the owner, is amazing!

27R1MvFzs9G9gmbs2VvIHQ.text: Absolutely fabulous! Best full English breakfast I had in all of London! And such a reasonable price!

RfpZi90vi9wW8x1dY41i7g.text: We walked like 30 minutes from our hotel to get to this place because it was so highly recommended.  (There's a newspaper clipping by the register that says this place is one of the top 5 restaurants in London.)  Um.... ok.   I can attest to the fact that London has some pretty freaking amazing food, but if this is in the top 5, I am seriously confused.  Perhaps I don't understand the "English Breakfast?"  Perhaps this place just has the best "English Breakfast" in London?   All I know is I'm an American for whom American brunch or diner food is the gold standard of breakfast dining, and this was definitely not either.   It was definitely an experience and had a lot of charm and character and was a great value.  It just wasn't mindblowing and was really the kind of food you could make for yourself  on a Sunday.  In London.  Or anywhere else.  Confused in America.

MbQTnhbUkBPKCtqFFyuHwg.text: I am so glad someone introduced me to this cafe. The line was off putting at first, but then you saw how it all just flowed like clockwork. The line may be out the door, but by the time you order, there is a table waiting for you. This is not a place to dine, this is a place to eat. Even during the work week, people can have a nice greasy fry up for lunch - and they do! The petite woman behind the counter cheerfully takes your order and then in an amazing turn barks it to the kitchen in a low register with a full use of daiphragm and projection. If I can find the video, I'll upload it.

Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

runJjEve-hISFK5c9qLidg.text: The wife and I really enjoyed the Regency's breakfast- definitely worth checking out if you're in the area!

pU47YNvHO9XmxKpSacHrcQ.text: On our trip to London and Berlin, it was tough to find good local (cheap) eats that didn't involve something from Asia. This place was kind of a sweet spot for getting some authentic British food. We took a little walk from Big Ben to get there, but it was well worth it. A couple of tips: dont sit before you order and eat and get out. They are generally really friendly, but operate like a well oiled (greased?) machine to keep the food going and the tables empty during lunch hour.

bW8LrC-58tir-cZ01ofeXQ.text: My mate and I were wondering around Regency Street when we noticed this nice restaurant. We had the English and you would think that its the same everywhere you go, however this place adds something special to it. I don't know what their secret is but it was delicious

MF3hMzsZP492AloyvKTchg.text: There is always a long queue but it's worth the wait. Once you have finally reached the counter where you can place your order, the food comes quickly. The scrambled eggs are light, tomatoes and mushrooms are well grilled. The atmosphere is friendly and the setting interesting.

4AIvsEX_4Ulm8aXalx4JNQ.text: A highlight for our food experience in London.  Basic food but done well and the prices are very reasonable.  There was a line but it moved efficiently and the restaurant was timely cleaned for new patrons.

tkEWiJSnZ7Byb09LjRmk_Q.text: Came here for breakfast early in the morning and we ordered the set breakfast deal (2 bacon, sausage, tomatoes, toast, and tea for 5.50 euro) and egg, 2 bacon, mushrooms, and bubble and squeak.  You order your food first then you find your table.  I liked the diner feel to this place and when your order is ready, they just yell out what you ordered and you go to the front to pick up your food.  The bacon they use is different from the states.  I definitely like London's bacon better.  We also thoroughly enjoyed "squeak", it's basically potatoes and bell peppers.  It was oily at all.  Usually potatoes are cooked with an immense amount of oil at diners.  When we ordered the eggs, they didn't ask us how we wanted it but I was glad it came over easy.  They were cooked perfectly.  Lots of locals come here in the morning and a line had been forming while we were eating.  Despite eating this meal early in the morning, it was so filling that I wasn't hungry until 2pm.  I would definitely recommend this place.  It's a corner restaurant so it shouldn't be too hard to find.

ToKn4szDeOhD2RtyytiPug.text: I am a huge nerd and had to come here because Layer Cake was filmed here. I had NO expectation about the food and thought that it would be just a greasy diner type of place. With that out of the way here's what I thought...This place is incredible. I got there around 10am and it was packed. Soon after I ordered there was a line out the door and it didn't slow down during the 45 minutes I sat and enjoyed my breakfast. I ordered the breakfast special, also my first full English breakfast. I received a HUGE plate full of baked beans, 2 sausages, an egg, 2 large strips of bacon, and 2 pieces of toast. I was a little scared of the baked beans at first but then I dug in and found that the mixture was delightful plate of heart stopping greatness! The sausages were something different, I can't really put my finger on it but it was almost if the filling was breaded or something...probably the best breakfast sausages I've ever had. I thoroughly enjoyed everything on my plate then sopped up all the leftovers with my toast and downed the rest of my tea. This breakfast really made my day and in fact I didn't have to eat anything until my dinner later that night, which is a whole other story (Fifteen London). I'm so glad that Matthew Vaughn introduced me to this place in his movie. Now I'm stopping in on every visit I make to London.

9Ey7XiBFIvtZ9yP8hVN2ew.text: My first and only true English breakfast.  A bit on the saltier side but I liked it.  It is nothing fancy.  It really isn't that much different from what you might find in the U.S.I liked the chill old school atmosphere.  Supposedly many films and commercials have been shot here.I was expecting it to be crowded but it really wasn't crowded at all.  I definitely recommend coming by for breakfast.

Q-7v9sUhiWDts0guOJdI_w.text: Great set English breakfast in a no-frills cafe. My husband got a burger he really enjoyed. Good service, too.

y7Wj29deeDTevw9KVgMMtg.text: Good food, great experience, very reasonable prices. We got there around 7:30 in the morning, so we didn't have to wait long for our food or at all for a table. It's clearly very popular with locals, which I always take to be a good sign.

67VlZH1CBi8sWH6vuF_kZA.text: Classic greasy spoon fare, and I mean that in the best possible way! The food is tasty, plentiful, and really well priced. The usual range of pies, full English breakfasts, and they're all good.If only this were nearer work I'd probably go there every day. It's like taking a step back in time when you walk inside.

BIyP9tijtA9yfgRfh2JMpA.text: It was one of the best experiences I had in London. Breakfast was amazing and the atmosphere was perfect.  It's a local place with local food. We had "special breakfast " for like 7$. Will keep you full for the whole day:)

EDn8TJZmu0wGraszoKmN3A.text: This place is awesome, If you want a home cooked meal, or Just simply good food.. this is Your place, came here 5x during my 3 week stay, Just for the breakfast alone.. it was about 1 mile away from 1 aldwych place (My Hotel), about every other day i wood walk to this place. taking different paths. Enjoyed the Walk & loved the food.Any & everyones Fav Breakfast place!!!

Mg7YyAqVby02baTUYoKNlg.text: Thanks Yelpers for helping me choose the perfect spot for an authentic full English breakfast! Taking a flight from Copenhagen at 7am, by the time we ended up here it was 12:30. So we were good and hungry. I took tips from all the reviews on how to order because this definitely is not the place to hem and haw at the menu. The line wasn't out the door but there was definitely a wait...beneficial to my husband because he had to absorb the menu. I did a great job ordering and got the set breakfast, black pudding (which sounds more appetizing than blood sausage), chips, beans and tea with milk. This is A LOT of food!! Hubs got the omelet with chips. So amazing and filling! We walked around London all day and didn't really get hungry until around 9 or so. The ambiance is fantastic! Oh...didn't happen to get my order taken by "the guy", but the lady working the desk was super sweet but could belt out an order like a drill sergeant!

4Exvt2dces1dcD4dMS3JVg.text: Just perfect. Regency Cafe does exactly what it sets out to do. I wish there was a spot like this in my neighborhood. Expertly cooked farm eggs with bright orange yolks, delicious English bacon, toast with salted butter, and surprisingly excellent coffee with steamed milk included by default. Oh, and it's quite inexpensive, with breakfast for two coming out to £9.This is the kind of place you could eat at practically every morning. I can't wait to go back.

EIvvslM0TYyjY5cnXsLFAg.text: Mutants exist and one of them is working at the counter of this fine establishment.As I perused the menu and tried to decide what I wanted, I felt my soul shake, yes my soul.  The woman working behind the counter, clearly using her mutation (because she's like 5'3") let out a booming call for set eggs, grilled tomato and bacon.  The normal patrons of this restaurant weren't phased but I spotted her from a mile away.I watched her closely as she took my order and asked me in a very polite voice whether I wanted coffee or tea.  I chose coffee and sat down.  Once again, the place rumbled when she called out the next order.When my breakfast finally was ready, I tried to be there and prompt but I picked up the wrong order.  This resulted in her telling me very loudly that I grabbed the wrong plate.  It's not her fault, it's her mutation.Perhaps she's a weird love child of Sebastian Shaw and Banshee?  She clearly absorbs energy, stores it and then transforms it into earth shattering sound waves.The breakfast was incredible.  Who knows what mutant powers lie in that kitchen?  Clearly the place was built by mutants because any normal structure would have crumbled by this point.A war is coming my friends.  Which side will you be on?

ESm_dkBJPfP3bY6oPUyOIw.text: Great system at this place and the guy behind the counter taking orders is wonderful. Straightforward and to the point yet extremely friendly and down to earth. Joking with customers whether they be regulars or tourists. We were the only tourists in at that time of day. People from all professions came to this joint for all types of breakfast dishes. I had the traditional set breakfast (2 slices of bacon, egg, sausage, beans, toast, and coffee) all for 5 pound 50 pence. CRAZY CHEAP for close to the city of London itself. Wonderful service, wonderful people, amazing food, and great price. I would go everyday if I could.

aZwaDDIDfLmzmYhIjRrM1Q.text: The rules:1. Order at the counter before you find a seat.2. Now take your tea and find a seat.3. Wait for your order to be called. Listen carefully.4. Go to the counter.5. Pick up your plate with impromptu napkin gloves - it's hot.6a. Listen for your toast to be called (if your order came with toast).6b. Pick up your toast.7. Eat.8. Say thank you if the counter man acknowledges you when you leave. It's polite.

IPQJMmuX9-qyYqD0YpPsdw.text: Wanted a nice traditional english breakfast, saw that this place was highly rated, and now i no why! Fast service, reasonable price and HUGE portions and of course everything was delicious.

QsagfEFZ25alWxiDPpgssQ.text: Perfect for some breakfast scoffing! YUM! You can't go wrong here!

FdOg7YJCbvFuSIiZBGN8JQ.text: Must for anyone visiting London. Simple good grub, inexpensive and a place locals go!

O2LjDFO-RrQA7T-eeMrw_g.text: Unbelievably poor service. Breakfast with an attitude. The man at the counter is very rude. It wasn't crowded at all. Walked up to the counter after glancing at the menu. Ordered the set breakfast deal and all I got was a blank stare and a "I don't understand." He told me to have a read and asked the person after me to order. After ordering it again I watched as he interacted with other customers. Specific ones he was very friendly with. Telling them to come in and take their time looking at the menu. Other times telling people they could not sit down until they ordered when another group did the same thing but did not get the same treatment. As for the food, it was overly salty and just mediocre. Nothing special. Highly overrated. If I had known I'd get breakfast elsewhere.

4w8rOEm99zUWk4sXAP3RlA.text: I don't quite get the hype - it's good, but not that different from loads of other caffs. Solid, decent, honest food. Probably not worht the wait, to me.

aOCQmvhcqCkRcTIPd0zc9A.text: Fast,hot and tasty , what's not to like?...I had a good honest breakfast for a fiver, happy  as Larry, though be prepared for the petit woman working at till, she makes her voice go so low when she shouts out the order it's a strange sight...well worth a visit

l75AuBonKhzbRfcKIhkq7A.text: We went here twice while in London because it was so good. Much better than pub food and cheap! Get the set breakfast with mushrooms and the bread. I also recommend the buttery bread pudding. It is huge so be prepared to share.

__0DwiAJcgp30k1ukW5aAA.text: Delicious and low priced. The personnel was very friendly and we got our food quickly despite the fact that it was really full.

pbWm3heOJxaugVmi6SoqtQ.text: We who are about to dine, salute you! The Regency Cafe is undoubtedly one of culinary jewels in Westminster's crown. First there's the 1940s original tiled interior, large windows and classic sign, which have featured in car adverts and the film Layer Cake. Then there's the moulded seating, complete with brown sauce, salt, vinegar and ketchup bottles for diners. Next there's the guy who takes your order, politely and respectfully noting your desired dish, and then later proceeding to announce its arrival from the kitchen with a bellowed "PIE AND CHIPS!") across the cafe when it's ready. And finally, the food, which is in a class of its own for honest, greasy spoon grub. Two dishes deserve special mention: First, the thick, roughly cut chips, which are deep fried on the spot. I don't know of many other places in London that come close, fish 'n chip shops included. Second, the bread and butter pudding which is likely to be like no other bread 'n butter effort you've encountered before: a collosal serving of approximately 5 slices of white bread with generous amounts of butter, sultanas and cinnamon in between, doused in hot steaming custard. It's quite simply the best bread and butter pudding I've tasted: my colleagues unanimously felt likewise.Prices are impressively competitive too - main dishes don't cost much more than a fiver and the bread and butter pudding a scarcely believable £1.60. It's not surprising then that this place is hugely popular at lunchtimes, with a queue of students, builders and office workers often leading up to and out of the door. It's best to arrive before 12:30 if you can, but even if you have to wait (and to be fair, the queue does move quickly), it's going to be worth it.

SrILbKBoG6xAIVz-0iCwJw.text: wow. believe the hype. the bacon is the best bacon I've ever had in my life. and the service is excellent....they really care about you as an individual customer!! i'll definitely be going back!!!

qb9CP95Jvmn509eKEZRHNg.text: This is a great and hardy place to eat breakfast. I like the relaxed diner atmosphere and the unpretentious wholesome food. I had the bacon, sausage eggs, hashbrowns with beans and my husband had the eggs benedict. Yummy.

Vd0108MAWMN9Xp3qvGF_DA.text: I ordered the full breakfast and it delivered exactly as I hoped for. The tea was nice and strong too. Definitely worth a visit if you're looking for some quality English breakfast food.

wC9RZPZNfxyPxL0Ze_3_ng.text: We are staying at the Conrad St. James and when I asked the hotel for breakfast recommendations they said Regency Cafe noting that it is not a fancy place,  but a great place for a good traditional meal. They hit it on the head with the description. Tons of character. Make sure to try there chips, they are awesome.

eKKJ8fmZ9TlUql_qcqi1cQ.text: I thoroughly enjoyed having brunch here. Like others have mentioned - it's cash only and you order at the counter before you sit down. The cashier was friendly and is a wonder at multi-tasking. Good sense of humor too. I got the set breakfast (£5.50) and at the recommendation of other Yelpers, added on the hash browns and black pudding (90p each). The food came out very quickly and was delicious! Definitely can pass on the recommendation of the 2 add-ons. I thought the cost of the food was a great deal. And that's coming from a frugal accounting graduate who's been backpacking across Europe for the past 2 months. The diner has a great atmosphere about it, was clean, and the busboys promptly cleaned the tables. And to top it all off, the cashier said a thank you to each customer as they headed out the door.

nHCTL_xw5o6DPH9nJgc5ew.text: If you want to hear the owner cursing at one of his staff then this is the place. I have never heard the F word so many times, he even managed to add the 'c' word at one point.  We didn't stay.  I don't want my children hearing that sort of language.

Pc0L5Lh_QfKnKEb-uuI2ww.text: The hubby first spotted the Regency Cafe when he watched the movie Layer Cake. He looked it up while we were recently in London and as the reviews were good, we ventured down to Victoria for our fix of a traditional English breakfast. All the tables were full when we got there, but the turnover moves quickly that we were able to get one once placing our order. Our breakfasts were generous size portions and they make great tea. Overall this is a fast casual diner and worth trying especially if you're in the neighborhood.

D2z--ReXflbhc1S_AY42kA.text: Great ambiance. Excellent service. Lot of great selections for everyone's taste. We didn't have to wait too long although the place was packed. I highly recommend it for to everyone.

ZWbnxjw3zDUWTfBOCTzhpg.text: Hands down the best breakfast I had when I was traveling in U.K. for two weeks. If I could, I would come here every other day for breakfast.I ordered my full breakfast set with some add-ons. And everything was cooked fast and almost to perfection, the beans, the mushrooms, the tomato, the sausage... Yum! It felt heavenly to munch on a plate of hot delicious full English breakfast.

TwgCFIXWcfll1EUzA7Wc7w.text: We stumbled across this place after watching the changing of the guards. Very much a  local place..and judging by the crowd...very popular. Some quirks in terms of "cash only" and "no seating until you get your order" but it works pretty efficiently and keeps things moving. AWESOME traditional English breakfast and food was served quickly and hot. Was also great for people watching and it was clear we were the only tourists in the place. Will definitely go back on my next trip.

of99y02p4zXyCv9M4YN-ng.text: The restaurant is very disappointing.  Everything on the table including the silverware was not clean.  The place looks like it needs a good scrub down.  This place has a high rating and is cheap but we couldn't eat some of the food because it was that salty.The only thing we could eat on our Full English was the toast and the eggs.

y-5zI8-Pba-mHYEJAG1LwQ.text: Situated off the main road sits this cute little corner diner.  What brought us here was its awesome reviews and because we were starving for some good breakfast.  Walked in at 9AM on a weekday and it was packed....don't people work???? lol the menu is simple and straight to the point. i went with just the usual "english breakfast" as they call it. But this was their combo special which comes with 1 fried egg, 2 bacons, 1 sausage, baked beans and toast (choice of white or wheat) or just bread and coffee or juice. i asked for an additional egg because.....we eats just ONE?   the beau went crazy and ordered the liver sandwich which is exactly what it is, pieces of liver stuffed between 2 white pieces of bread. he also ordered orange juice which comes in a jar and they give you glasses to fill them in. our order total came out to ￡10.50 which may seem like a GREAT deal.....until you convert it...and realized it actually cost $15 (-_-) that's London for ya.other than the price, the food was wonderful and the service was really friendly. theres this lady probably in her 40's that works the counter and man, she's a beast! taking all the orders, grabs the beverages, prepares the toast and bellows out your order once its ready! the only thing she doesnt do is go into the kitchen and cooks the food!the people working here are genuinely really nice. just a few notes: its cash only, there are no restrooms here and order first before grabbing a seat!

77tDX8-SwNlNWK1uUB2Ygw.text: What I Ordered: Bacon/Cheese sandwich on white bread.Flavor:  I never imagined something as simple as a bacon/cheese sandwich could taste so good.  I'm from the US so I'm not used to this thicker type of bacon, that's more akin to pork chops and I LOVE IT!  The bread tasted very fresh.Service: This is one of those places where they know the food is so good that they can afford to have bad service.  The guy at the counter will scold you if you dawdle while ordering, so just be prepared for that.Atmosphere: Old timey mid-century looking diner.  You feel like you stepped into a time machine back to the 50s.Price: Good for what you get.Location: Not really near the city center, so the Uber drive there was a bit pricey.Other Comments:  There will be a line when you come here, but it moves fast as they are very efficient in getting orders out.

WLY5YLSxw83ZuRZKGg6RiQ.text: Got the "Set Breakfast Deal" and was pretty good (: comes with 1 egg, 2 bacon, 1 sausage, your choice of tomatoes or beans, bread or toast, tea or coffee and have extra sides for £1. Total comes out to £6. Only downside is if you choose toast and want jam it comes out to extra. (They charge for Jam). The owner is very amicable and attentive. Would recommend if you're looking for an English breakfast

bzo4ec9cQUEdRdiBOE3plg.text: Amazing full English breakfast. This is the best place if you're in London and want something easy, quick, and simple, but high quality. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the tea is piping hot. Everything is checked off for a great place for breakfast.

3bYWsCWr0BGH8lc35hXfag.text: Great breakfast!! Good price for a traditional English breakfast and fortunately I went close to lunch so it was a little difficult to find a seat.

50ujU3KJ9uOQbAHU-ZZgeA.text: Great food, very friendly and quick service, affordable prices. My husband and I stopped here for lunch on our last day in London. We both had a large burger with chips, with a coffee and a chocolate sponge (served hot with custard). Everything was delicious! And all for under 15 pounds , which seems like a miracle in London!

TSeEF8IklPfOxksVhqkMHQ.text: Very good English breakfast for excellent value. Menu is quite standard -- and you get the flexibility to either make your own dish or order the set deal. Ambience is quite low key -- what you would expect of a local English breakfast joint. With that said, there is a certain gravitas this place exhumes with all the frames on the walls of celebrities having been and gone, autographs, etc. Service is good -- the line moved by relative fast. Nonetheless, I do think there would be a way to make the system more efficient. Overall, very good option for your local breakfast experience.

zOG3BAem1Qmj9Y7AcnGMSA.text: Some of the best value Fry ups in London, and worth going for the experience alone. Your order is taken and when it's announced it's called by an announcer with s booming voice. You then get to eat in the delightful cafe which feels like it's not changed since the 60s surrounded by civil servants, off duty police officers and a variable crowd of characters

6_qGX_ddUJPrC6fdzVZRbg.text: I mean, I don't even like fish and this place was outstanding. Perfect way to sit by the shore and enjoy a beautiful day in Brighton.

PdFloopXqpXdat4_HfgzJQ.text: Omg i came into this place and the first impression is the magnificent voice yelling the orders.  We ordered a traditional english breakfast with blood sausage at the very famous breakfast cafe.   Lost of memorabilia on the walls. One of the posters is the victory of cassius clay vs Sonny Liston.  The food is fresh and very tasty.  Love the blood sausage    Very reasonable prices.   I will be back whenever in London.

Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

qSYdvSzHmyIQAQtVTTS5LA.text: I love me a good English breakfast and nothing was as good and affordable as Regency Cafe. I spent 10 days in London and went to an English breakfast eatery every other day (I am not a heathen!) and this by far was the best one.The location is small, on a corner street, and the tables were pretty full when I got there. The fine people of London are considerate and they move fast so other folks can get a table. I saw other people come up to a large table and ask if a spot was taken and they accommodated without hesitation.What gets me is the owner of this place. A fit, small, and short-haired older woman who can bellow out orders like a football captain. When I first walked up to the queue, I thought some big burly chef from the back was calling out the orders but it was the lady running the registers!I ordered the set breakfast which consisted of eggs, bean, sausage, bacon, and toast. For an extra 90 pence each I received hashbrowns and a fried tomato as well. Total damage done with Tea and Orange juice was just 8.90 pounds. Wow! If you're looking for a traditional English breakfast, this place is the bees-knees and I hope I threw enough British lingo in this review to make me sound like I am a native ;-)Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Set breakfast!

eGavlSxr28hJ5C7rDDjlDg.text: I came here for breakfast today and it was an experience! There was a queue coming out of the door at around 9am when we got there but it moved pretty quickly! So the premise is, you queue up to order and then take a seat and when your food is ready, the lady taking your order shouts it out! The funny thing is, she is very softly spoken when taking your order hit as soon as the food comes out, her voice totally changes! I ordered the breakfast for £5.55 and for an extra 90p had a block of bubble and squeak on the side however you can also order a portion of hash browns (3 pieces) or black pudding. The breakfast came with 2 pieces of toast and butter, a fried egg, one sausage, two rashers of bacon and beans and a cup of tea or coffee. I also got an orange juice which is ordered in straight from the dairy and served in milk bottle which I thought was quite novel. The decor is like an old fashioned cafe, white tiles on the wall and plastic chairs with random pictures adorning the walls. I loved this place and I really want to go back and have some lunch there!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

zjGq774eRfH66oIK88awUA.text: **Cash only!!*If I learned anything during my stay in London, it's that the English are a no-frills people, and this cafe is a perfect example. I researched a bunch of places before hand but then decided to just walk around until i found a nice pub that served breakfast. But then i rounded the corner and saw the Regency cafe and boy, was it meant to be.What we got: the traditional English breakfast: egg, 1 sausage, 2 bacon, beans, toast, tea/coffee (ADD ONS: the black pudding and hash browns- these are a must!!)Everything was beyond amazing, who knew i could fall in love with a hash brown??You have to go.

612SdrBHaOUAvu7IK-uKSg.text: Line out the door.  We stayed in the neighborhood for three nights and there was always a line out the door. There is no hostess and no seat saving.  You line up, order you food and somehow a table frees up in time for your food to come out.  Came here for breakfast and the food was solid.  Big English breakfast, eggs, bacon, sausage, beans, toast and coffee...not fancy but great local atmosphere.

VgCPg0cOSmDdwFKnR82C6Q.text: This is our first introduction to English culinary. We trusted yelpers to send us to the right place. Overall, food was good but not great. I ordered the chicken and mushroom pie and hubs ordered eggs Benedict with salmon. Yes, it's not expensive but it's a "cash only" place and it sucks for hungry tourists who don't have the currency. But I'm glad we tried this yelper's fave!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

nsevXdo4YH-SyPWJF-Wu8g.text: This is definitely a good value, and in London where everything is so expensive, it's quite nice to be able to really find something that will satisfy your cravings without emptying your walled. The english breakfast is great. You can get all of the staples and trimming and probalby won't spend more than 15 lbs. Regencey Cafe is also quite accessible from the touristy areas. You have to walk, but the area is quite nice and easy to navigate. while the food is good, i've never been a big fan of the english breakfast, so I wouldn't have come here except for the fact that a friend wanted to, but it was totally worth it. You can tell the staff has been doing this for awhile. The orders are put out rapid fire and while a bit abrasive, the attitudes of everybody are actually more confident and rather warm once you get talking with them. The facilities are pretty average if not below it, but what do you expect from a diner type restaurant? I would drop by anytime you are in the area. It is well worth it. It might not impress anybody, but it'll beat almost anything else you make at home hungover.

WV2B44zcSbz0joeO4JeeXQ.text: Rude service, no toilets, and a non-cosy atmosphere? Why four stars you ask? - Best breakfast in London for a good price!- It doesn't get any more british than this.- Sitting in Al Pacino's place. If that's not enough, almost no tourists there, really great find!

MZo8ElrZY0MkJpX11JphZw.text: Absolutely fantastic.  Great breakfast and the bubbles and squeak are a must have add-on.

gQpj89C6xhrmuskHV-b_AA.text: This cafe was a 40 min ride from my our hotel and we had to come here two days in a row! You truly feel part of Britain society when you come here. The service is quick and good. The food is definitely a British experience. First day i orders the English breakfast with blood sausage. YUM! a very hearty meal indeed. Second day i felt a little more adventurous and ordered the steak pudding, which turned out to be a mini pie, lol! That was good as well, but i preferred the English breakfast.

hm4wybIk-VSgqaZoTZRAVA.text: I'm renting a room walking distance from Regency Cafe, so when I hopped on Yelp to see what's good in the area, this place came up.  I came here for lunch around 3pm a couple of days ago, and was really torn on what to offer.  My exchange went something like this:"What's good here?""Everything.""I was thinking about a burger or a salad.""Get a steak pie.""OK."I'm paraphrasing, but I pretty much go with what the staff recommends if at all possible.  I wasn't disappointed, as you can see from my picture.  It was delicious, though I think I probably would have preferred a salad that day.  It was a ton of food for the price, though, and I can't believe how packed this place was.  Definitely wish I had come for a full English breakfast as that just sounds so good.  Next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Steak pie, chips, & peas

YJchUCAV65_guHbzsGJ4dw.text: After an 9 hour flight, I needed to get my first British breakfast fix and Regency Café didn't disappoint. Great staff makes everyone feel welcome. I would come make back for the great food and atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Ah my first meal in London, after a long 9 hour flight. Well worth the wait

Bfg1zLuALs7Wt3AhftN-UQ.text: Outstanding full English breakfast for an incredible bargain. They also offer other items, such as  breakfast sandwiches, corned beef, etc.  The hash browns are amazing.  The portions are hearty and you can easily share entrees.  The service is no nonsense but very friendly, efficient, and accommodating, as in, you should know what you want by the time you get to the front of the line to keep with the pace of business but they will also make whatever you want.  Want a full breakfast with beans, a side of grilled tomatoes, and hash browns, tea, no milk? no problem.   the lunch menu looked equally appetizing but we didn't have a chance to eat lunch there. would go back in a heartbeat.

FMBkXZkLpTf2fuPsVYkqKw.text: Been here a few times and it is safe to this that this is good value for money and staff were polite, considerate and helpful. The food was nice and had that classical English breakfast aroma. For me I enjoyed the eggs, sausages and bacon. The eggs were particularly interesting, and were not the sort thing I would encounter. Having said that, the meal was great and I would pop down here again :)

AxjACfPN03IQYQvRFgczyA.text: Terrific British caffe with a hostess/order taker with an unbelievable shouting voice. The set breakfast comes with 1 egg, 2 bacon, sausage, beans or tomato, bread or toast, and tea or coffee all for £5.50. Black pudding, bubbles and squeak, and hash browns can be added for 90p each. GET THE HASHBROWNS! They are worth it.Order at the register first, grab a seat, and remember what you ordered so you can go grab it when it gets shouted. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Set breakfast with beans, toast, hashbrowns, and black pudding. 7.30
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. The line and a feel for the ambience.

LqeScGXR4k68exfAKPHrNg.text: Classic, old school, timeless - it is an amazing place. What makes this place special for me is the front man - hard core, old school, great working man, someone you would expect from a film  - he stands for the place, he manages the place... Everything about him is about the place.  What a timeless place - loved it!I was there for breakfast - the menu is old school, expect nothing fancy but good old cupper, simple coffee accompanying simple eggs, bacon, sausages and beans... And it is absolute value- you would struggle to eat more than £7 pp with drinks for breakfast. Definite must try - if you are driving, remember all curbside parking is free on weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Busy counter
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast deal

svY3uUOZ-_A0khNBcbP0LA.text: Totally top notch! Quality ingredients, consistently excellent! Regency Cafe serves the best cooked breakfast in London. After three years living in the United States, I returned to London in July 2014, got off the plane at 7am and went straight to the Regency Cafe for, at last, a taste of home. Best cuppa ever!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. "Sausage, beans and chips!!"

V_sR2sFS39BDG1SsT5hrQg.text: My only mistake was waiting until my final breakfast to eat here.2 eggs, 2 bacon, mushrooms, and Earl Grey tea for £4.70.  The only thing special about this place is that the food is fast and excellent.  Cash only, very inexpensive, and quick.  I came at an off hour so I didn't have a wait, but I can understand why it would be packed otherwise.A really small place, right on the corner, you can nearly miss it walking by.  You walk in, order, and find a table.  Then you wait for them to call (and I mean loudly call) your order to go pick up at the counter.There's nothing I can find special about the food, its just really good!  No special preparation, no frills, but I think that's probably the point.  It is the best breakfast I've had here.  If you're near the area you must go.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Eggs, bacon, mushrooms, and Earl Grey.

8dMHbQLBqucPddEMAEB3Jg.text: Ever since this little cafe was listed in the Wall Street Journal as one of the yelpiest places in London, I had bookmarked it. Alas, months went by without me converting that bookmark into action...and I was already afraid that by the time I would finally get there, the place would be so overrun that it'd lost its yelpiness. (As I've witnessed many times when hidden gems get written up by major publications.)I am happy to report: all good. The place is (still) amazing and the owner still loudly shouting out the orders when they're ready. In a parallel world, this guy would be an opera singer for sure, with such a baritone voice; imagine Pavarotti shouting "two eggs with beans and hash browns coming up!"Here's a tutorial on how to order:* make sure you've got cash on you* you need to place your order before grabbing a seat, so get in line* while in line, take advantage of this and watch the folks rotating behind the counter and in the kitchen; it truly is the perfect human assembly line* get the set breakfast and customize it as you like (if there's two or more of you, I recommend getting a bottle if fresh orange juice as well)* once you've placed your order, go find a seat and listen to your order being shouted out* enjoy your food* afterwards I highly recommend a digestive walk along the nearby Thames...May this place stay like this for a very long time...it's timeless and perfect as it is.

b555i6NkRgtZ9C_hX_1pJw.text: Wow! What an incredible breakfast spot! Beats the hell out of any diner back in the states.You order at the counter and then seat yourself. When your order is up, the man taking orders calls it out and you go and fetch it. This was quick! Under ten minutes from when I placed my order till I was eating it.They offer a variety of breakfast specials, or a la carte. I chose the fried tomatoes,  mushrooms, hash browns, chips, and 2 eggs. Also a cup of tea and a bottle of orange juice. The eggs were perfectly cooked. Not runny in the slightest but still with a soft enough yolk for dipping. The mushrooms were savory and well cooked, the tomatoes also. Hash browns and chips were fried just right; crispy and delicious. Writing this review is making me hungry! I'll certainly be back in the morning. I went in around 11:15 am, brunch... not too crowded but definitely busy. Ample seating and good atmosphere. The portion was very generous, and the price was unbeatable. My entire meal cost about £7.30, including juice and tea!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Making me hungry looking @ this mornings brunch. I want to eat it againnnn
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. My brunch! All for under 10 (change on the right) :]

446JXgtJDyt8w9JLphm5pQ.text: GO HERE FOR A GREAT ENGLISH BREAKFAST. So much good. The set breakfast comes with one egg, two pieces of bacon, one sausage and either beans OR tomato and either toast OR bread. Toast is just white toast and bread is thick white bread with butter on it, served cold. Also comes with coffee OR tea. Add hashbrowns that are sooo good and also the bubble and squeak. Set breakfast with one side is only £6.90. Order at the counter, and pick it up to bring it to your table.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Set.

WI5TVRhuaw88kcNhr3Mc0g.text: Very autenthic place, love it! Every time i come to london i m going for a fully english here, especialy after a long nite out.

_LvVPth3M0cRoMVs5UbBdg.text: This place is next to my flat, so I thought I'd finally give it a try before noon (they close sharply at noon). Super rude service, and okay food.  The woman behind the counter is a real yeller, with a very deep voice, which I think adds to the charm.  A lot of yelpers (even my brother) talk about a man yelling, maybe there is a male who also does this?This is how my experience went:Arrived with cash (no credit accepted), waited patiently in the queue for 25 min, practised how to orderme: I'll have the set breakfast, with tomato her: and you? (to my friend, the second I finished my last syllable)I wasn't done yet. I want a side of hash browns. So, when my friend finished ordering, I said "and also, can I have a side of hash browns please?"  She rolls her eyes, sighs, writes it down, looks rudely at us, and asks "anything else?" with her hands in the air (like a 'hold up' style). RUDE. Keep in mind, the lady was very cheerful and patient with the man ahead in queue, who kept amending his order. My order was over in 12 seconds - he took a minute or more. You wait in queue for a bit, and it stops moving periodically - pretty sure they intentionally delay the queue so that tables clear up (makes sense). So, you can always find a table, no problem. The food - nothing to write home about. The bacon was way overly salty. The tomatoes are canned.  The sausage was ok. Egg and toast were good. I added one star for the Ok food, but the service was shit..however it seems to be hit or miss judging by the way others were received.

nCttpRyiDFpT_LF-taTmLQ.text: I came here last year in September 2016 and I still think about this restaurant on a weekly basis. My boyfriend and I just booked another trip to London for January (from California) and I'm pretty sure we're coming back just to eat here. Six more months...sigh.

OIxTcctMwxi6UQDlN4Ai2w.text: I was so glad this was my last meal in London before leaving for New York. This place looked so authentic for a quick and easy British breakfast. My boyfriend and I came here around 11am on a Thursday which was good timing because this place looks to be constantly busy, full of locals and tourists. A long line quickly formed after 11:30 but the execution and delivery of food is rather quick once your order is put in. Order first and then sit. I ordered the breakfast deal which included an egg, sausage, bacon, beans or tomatoes, bread or toast. I got an add-on of black pudding and hash browns which was absolutely delicious. Everything was really delicious. Simple yet full of flavor and tasted freshly cooked. For a meal under 10 pounds, this was well worth it. The hash browns were nice and crispy, bacon was salty and well-cooked, beans were soft and plentiful, black pudding was black and delicious for the more adventurous eaters. A great last meal. I would definitely come back again if ever in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast set with extras of hash browns and black pudding

ZziSu1sCijpxQ7t4r5vOTg.text: I was told a perfect British breakfast could be found at Regency Cafe. Don't know if it was perfect but I do know it was the best I have had! The "set breakfast" was one fat, tasty sausage, two bacon (more like ham slices), cottage potatoes, grilled tomatoes, egg, and toast. I ordered squeaks but didn't get them. I guess I could have complained but my plate was full enough without them.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

J2TgS_vJG9XTyg94NqMH1w.text: If you're in visiting London, you have to take in the full English breakfast once. And there's no better place to do it than one that's been serving up plates of gloriously greasy breakfast staples for 7 decades.The line will likely be leading out the door when you arrive: don't fret, turnaround at this tiny cafe is very quick. The Regency Cafe offers up a pretty sizeable menu for breakfast, but most people seem to get the 'set breakfast': fried egg, bacon, sausage, beans or tomatoes, bread (toasted or not) and tea or coffee for £5.50. Extras, like hash browns, black pudding, or bubble and squeak (fried potatoes, cabbage, and veggies) are only 90p more.Once you order, stake out a seat and wait for the lady at the counter to bellow out your dish. Pick it up, return to your seat, bask in full breakfast deliciousness.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Set breakfast: egg, bacon, sausage, tomato, black pudding, bread and butter

lqRYJm0Z7JwS612Vh_-HSQ.text: Food: I am regular customer here and have never been disappointed! The food is always to a good standard and there are plenty of options on the menu. Their English breakfast is one of the best in England you'll find! The fish and chips on a Friday are a must! The fish is very fresh and they have a variety of different types of fish. The chips are the typical English 'chippy' style! Other items on the menu are also delicious such as their chicken fillet burger and the mushroom and chicken pie. Price: Very affordable and reasonable, given the central London location. However it is cash only (with no nearby cash machine!)Atmosphere: Very traditional and old English cafe that hasn't had a refurbishment since it's establishment by the looks of it! Their are plenty of locals and the cafe has a very homely feel. One of the only remaining 'old school' English cafes! Highly recommend this for a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Customised breakfast. 2 eggs on toast, baked beans, mushrooms and hash browns.

ZlcYlfYgVapRvaCchDm1Jw.text: Very famous place; one concern would be hygiene.  The guy at the register, a gray-haired older man about age 60, 5'2" in height, touching the money, touching the cash register, touching the toast, touching the plates, very hot day and reaching in his shirt at the gap in the front of his belly, then taking a wet washcloth and wiping stuff down, then re-using it.  Watched this for about 30 minutes. Never saw him wash his hands. I'm sure it is probably fine, most people have good immune systems, and they likely get a pass due from health department as they are an icon, but a bit concerning.

xAWoxeEYhRSeQfBeGg0whw.text: CASH ONLY!  Plan to wait in line to put in your order and have it bellowed out by a wonderfully enthusiastic owner.  It never seems like there will be a table open by the time you put your order in, but have no fear - the turn around time is quick.  I got a proper English breakfast, vegetarian style, which would be an egg, baked beans, toast, grilled tomatoes, grilled mushrooms, a side of hash brown and a cup of rosy tea. It was perfection and cheap!  FYI closed on Sundays even though it says open online.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. A proper English breakfast (vegetarian)

aWAXgwF5MyX-u2u3vqItjw.text: Very authentic British breakfast experience for a tourist. No frills. Very yummy. Hearty.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

8iOkv65jXRV-aLmAzyvwZQ.text: Best meal I had in London!!!! It doesn't really get better than delicious yet affordable food. Be sure to have cash though because it's cash only. We went a little before noon and the place was already packed with a decent line that never got much shorter the entire time we were there. The menu is pretty simple. I got the egg, sausage, and beans with a side of hashbrowns (which is like 3 pretty big hashbrowns btw) and a tea. All of this was maybe £5??? SO GOOD. My +1 got a dish with tomatoes and he still talks about those tomatoes, they were that good. Seating always looks full AF but people are coming and going so often that everyone seems to find a place to sit by the time their food is ready. It helps that you can't sit down until you've ordered.The guy taking the orders has this great booming voice that we were all in awe of lol. We loved this place so much HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Also, this place seems to be a local hotspot so get ready to feel authentic AF.

4teNySMIH-xMF0nhTKmcMQ.text: We wanted to eat here every day during our stay. Unfortunately it didn't work out with some of our plans. But we still ate there three times. The line can be crazy but it's highly worth it. I was always worried about getting a table but it seemed to work out each time. I loved the lady who takes the orders. She was so polite and helpful, but still made the line move along efficiently. Her ability to belt out orders over the loud crowd was incredibly impressive. And the food. Oh my, the food.
