Just to die for!  If you want a good, no frills, solid, delicious, satisfying breakfast (do I need more adjectives?) that will last you until late dinner, get the set breakfast. Go ahead, add in some hash browns. You've earned it. I dream about those rashers. And the sausage- mix it with the beans. Oh man. Yes please. And let's not forget those perfectly poached eggs. And to wash it all down a perfect cup of tea. All for a very cheap price! The value is just incredible.We had no idea when we stumbled upon this place that it's one of the top rated restaurants in all of Great Britain.  We truly hit the jackpot.America, please learn from England. This is the way to do breakfast. It does not need to be fancy and overdone. Also, can we please get some rashers over here?

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. The main event. Full English Breakfast. I couldn't even wait to eat my eggs on toast before I took the picture. Sorry not sorry.
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Cheese and onion pasty with chips. Amazing.

a1DJjz_cmrtb3vsBuT5j_g.text: Want to eat like a local? Check out Regency Café, and order the Breakfast set! Eggs, bacon, sausage, baked beans, toast, and coffee for less than £10. It can't get ant better than that!Staff is friendly, food is good, what more do you want?

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast set.... delicious!

qEMu4_41EO2F0-KJetLtPA.text: Such a great place for breakfast or lunch!  Definitely a local hotspot.  Cash only and you bring your own plate to your table.  The line can get long.  For the type of food and the experience it's as good as it gets!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Front of the place.
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Typical breakfast here.  I cleaned my plate!

mnyOLE9hUPV8yjQSd0VVJw.text: We had to stop in to get a proper English breakfast and, this place did not disappoint. I really enjoyed my meal, especially the eggs, toast, sausage and tea. The beans really threw me for the loop but considering the bacon, this meal will keep you full until dinner. Aside from the meal, we were quite entertained my the lady taking and passing out food orders. She is very soft spoken during the ordering process but once the food was ready to be picked up, she transforms into a public announcement system speaker. She definitely keeps this place running in tip top order.

Km1nej_o2rk-BnZMqZBLMg.text: This place was absolutely phenomenal. The food is absolutely amazing and leaves you very full. The best part of it is, is that it is not a gimmick. The prices are more than fair and definitely super affordable. I loved it here, and if I ever find myself in this part of London again, I'll be coming back for sure!

AfQcOcVyGzCC7Yujb2w-YQ.text: Take the set breakfast if it's your first time here as a visitor.  Get to try the whole set.  classic and lovely taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Remind me of HK a bit.
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. delicious, local, classic haha

-_b6LLPZWDXwVpUv2tNzPg.text: Great service and incredible food for a reasonable amount of pounds. The seating system is a little weird but works great.

5yz7qy1EEAJbaeOAHTXzeQ.text: Regency Cafe has a very homey vibe and seemed to cater to lots of locals, which was exactly what we were looking for. We got two dishes:- egg and chips- sausage, well done egg, beansA couple of odd observations:- The texture of the scrambled egg was so odd, it was so fluffy that it looked like soft tofu or pudding/custard, especially as you slice through the egg. It was strange. The egg was also rather unspiced, but maybe thats the norm and its best left to the consumer to dress the egg.- The size of each dish was rather disproportionate. The egg and chips was a heaping plate, while the sausage, egg and beans was lacking.Regardless, it was a relaxing spot to have breakfast at an affordable price.

hCv8s6jl3-3Nupg1T7DYxw.text: Ordered their Friday lunch special, lasagna, chips with ham and two eggs. All of them were great! It was my first time trying fish and chips in London and the Friday special left me a great impression! Lasagna also so soft and full of the creamy and cheesy flavor!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Friday lunch special with cod and mashed peas

W_sKa6DjsDsp0srW60xQJw.text: We got here at 11:50am. Just before the lunch rush crowd. So missed long line. Breakfast huge portion. Bacon a bit salty. Counter lady very loud as it necessary to tell orders ready, but very very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Omlette with mushroom and onions. Bacon. Black pudding

Txov97sNP-p7wPbp1-Usyg.text: We headed here as our last stop before heading to the airport in London.  We shared the eggs, sausage, bacon, hash browns, toast, corned beef.  The eggs were really unique in that they had this texture kind of like flan or crème brulee.  Hash browns were decently crispy on the outside but undercooked in the middle.The corned beef was not edible as a side for breakfast.  Weirdest taste and texture ever.  Bacon was good as it was more like pork belly than bacon.  Sausage was not memorable and the stewed tomatoes were not something I could swallow.  Overall, it was a-ok, but I'm sad we wasted our last meal in London here as it was not a 5 star meal.  We also Uber'd across town for it.  Cheap eats, yes.  Foodie destination...no.  A-ok experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Corned beef

f7LpfGUVmuhPlLw-bmcGow.text: Headed here for breakfast after a set of disappointments in the morning and this breakfast really perked us up.It is such a lovely space, well lit and welcoming. Given the summer like weather (finally), the doors were open and even at 10am, we saw that it was quite full inside.Based on advice from previous reviews and tips, we knew exactly what we wanted before we reached the front of the line and had cash ready for payment.Full English and corned beef with a side of mushrooms with orange juice. (The full English comes with tea or coffee) The mushrooms were really really good. The bacon was thicker than the really flimsy ones you get st some places, but not too thick. Sausage was lovely and the eggs, cut through the saltiness of the meats.There were a lot of chips and we could not finish that, I also saw them left over in a lot of other plates around.Bread is white, coffee is standard- with or without milk. This is not a fancy coffee place where you can order a low fat soy Macha latte. It's down-to-earth food, served up with all the affection of a harried mum in the kitchen at breakfast time.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Corned beef with extra mushrooms

ob4XYyls_lFBBf_r3c2_2w.text: This seems like the kind of place my grandfather might have liked. I'm not used to eating beans for breakfast and British bacon is new to me, but I'm going to miss this kind of food when I go back to the states.

F-O-un2hyEojLYhssptw1A.text: Great spot for traditional English breakfast. Staff are nice and keep the place humming. Reasonable prices for tasty food. Food is really good, but it's not remarkable or of a quality that you couldn't get at other good breakfast spots. Would certainly go back if in the area but wouldn't go far out of my way for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Proper English breakfast
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Interior

6tZ8ds_D5s63pBwKb-ThVw.text: The best English Breakfast in England! There's a reason why there's always a line here, and it's simply amazing to watch how people are moved through from order to table, even with that long constantly-moving line. Get your English Breakfast with Bubble & Squeak (potatoes with veggies placed strategically under the egg)!Overall, the Law of Diminishing Marginal Returns does not apply here. I could eat that breakfast every day for the rest of my life and STILL love it! :-)

-I39ljM3Dw9CYuBKbWk5aA.text: Fast, good value, full portions. I came here for breakfast and the line moved briskly. Eggs, toast, chips and sausage were good.

loO2BdzzBicpQoFRsdE3IA.text: Love love love love this place.  Plain but the food was amazing.  Just as recommended by others on yelp.  Glad I took the chance and will definitely visit again.

ec7SyVsZM7QJWCDS8l75tQ.text: This place is great! Bring cash, get in line, and be ready to order. Have a seat and listen for your order to be bellowed out by the counter person. The food itself is just good honest fare. There's certainly no posturing or pretending to be fancy. Heck, I took a bus back the next day instead of eating at one of the many places nearer to where I was staying.

YoykZSQOOyGlBq4dATOnEQ.text: It doesn't open on a bank holiday today. Please don't put a "open" here. Hope no one walk here then find nothing to eat and feel so disappointed like me.

d1AFj9obwKSHKyGmJft2Qg.text: Is the food good? I guess, I cannot say but my husband really liked what was on his plate. I'm from Paris, France but live in California. I've been in London a few times and I love this city. I was really excited to take my husband for the first time for our honeymoon. I did all my research of where to go eat as my husband and I love to eat. When I saw the good reviews and rating on yelp, well I wanted to give it a shot so we went one morning. Unfortunately that morning I didn't feel like sausages, beans and stuff like that so I was looking for something that would make my sweet tooth happy. When I asked for a slice of cake, the guy behind the cashier (I think he was the owner) rolled his eyes at me, was irritated with me and made me feel so uncomfortable and so stupid for asking a simple slice of cake. Apparently the cake was only for lunch so I had to order toasts and eggs but I was so upset that I didn't even touch my plate. I would never go back and I do not recommend this place if you want to have a nice time and a good experience. They need to work on their customer service!

MsM7wQgsv2P9-h5BS329KA.text: Took the breakfast deal with eggs, sausage, beans, toasts and a  milk tea and added a pint of orange juice for 7£ total. This kind of breakfast will sustain you till mid afternoon, it's simple and effective : just how I like it!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Breafast deal with an extra pint of orange juice

nKvk_3lUgn52IyUnLtoV6Q.text: This is exactly the right place to eat a Full English if you're touristing in London.

LAjcbNwFUDJwwGCiijOdrg.text: A must go! A traditional "Greasy Spoon" where the bacon is perfect, the eggs are fresh and the service is excellent.

jOMPafDR5jCCMvVh4b6Bsw.text: One of the reasons why I wanted to visit London again from Los Angeles was because I wanted to try Regency Cafe.Yeah, I'm a Layer Cake fan, so I HAD to come here. I tried it a few days ago and I fell in love. I gave my order and in a few minutes, it was hot and ready. There was so much on the menu, and a long long behind me, so I got the egg, sausage, and chips, which was fabulous. Everything was prepared perfectly, and the chips were amazing!! I definitely want to come back again before going back to LA.Regency Cafe, I wish there were 6 stars on yelp!

3GJNd8oUJmM8GCKBqdy-pg.text: The best breakfast in london.  You'll never be disappointed with  what you order here. The set breakfast with tea, toast and beans: best of British. Orange juice served in vintage milk bottles and the lady serving at the front, who's voice needs no microphone is a staple here.

c-znI27zq6B07YPLT5YcIA.text: As all the reviews say this is an institution. The food is all freshly cooked and no nonsense staples. I always have the chicken escalopes-wonderful! Chips are crispy and dry. Service is brisk and there are certain rules you need to adhere to-like not taking a seat until you have your food! The orders are shouted out by the owner in a voice which would drown out a sergeant major. If you want to come at lunch time best get there a little later as tables are at a premium.  Highly recommended.

yrYa6IKIf_h9SBJMtUHP9g.text: A favourite place to go for lunch, with faultless food and prices, and owners that are full of character. The only negative is that there aren't more tables for 6, which meant we had to split up, but there's not much the owners can do about that. I had chicken escalope and chips, it was crispy, huge and delicious, and only set me back a fiver, with a 50p pint of squash to wash it down.

bOOUBNMtkD_pipPjVenJ8Q.text: Such. good. breakfast. You can complain about how overpriced London is, but this place is a good way to get away from all the pretentiousness. Just good, old fashioned, breakfast food. Know what you're getting before you get to the register to order, and make sure you pick up your beverages and your toast before you sit down. Do not attempt to snag a table before you order, because you will upset the balance of the place. There is always a table available by the time you've ordered, just by virtue of how the place is run. Don't be that douche who hogs a table before you've even ordered.

BXQi6_nYhT2kCipv2HZgMw.text: As authentic as it gets not just for the food but the experience of eating at a cafe/diner in London. From the gruff man working the register to the classic eggs, sausage, bacon, beans, and toast breakfasts, this was a worthwhile stop for a casual morning bite. I knock one star for having no bathroom for guests.

mSuoxcCio24fVskQGKrQbQ.text: A real greasy spoon! Great place to get a proper fry-up.Its a great place so it's not unusual to need to queue, but the service is great so it goes down in no time at all. And the food is worth any wait entailed.Writing about it makes me want to go back!

m3EGhGaiY75zu3QSdJqjPw.text: I have taken a while to get around to this review. This place was so memorable. I was watching the new Bletchley circle this weekend and I was crazy with excitement to see it on the show. When we travel we like to experience what the locals enjoy so on our trip to the UK last year my hubby found it on yelp and loved the description of the owner. We took a bus and had a  wonderful experience. The owner is a character. We still tell everyone about his great way of pouring the tea. The food was typical British breakfast food. We cannot wait to return to London and I want to go back to experience this place again. The street outside looks like a movie set and I love the way the place inside looks untouched for 60 years. I am sure there was minimal set dressing required for the Bletchley circle plot.

w_tWfhJCSBQPowEk9pkdig.text: This was actually a very nice experience. It is busy with plenty of locals. The breakfasts are of good portion size. I am not a coffee drinker, but it was actually very tasty. I would easily go back to this place for another breakfast the next time I'm in England. A note to all: there is no public restroom in the restaurant itself. there is a public one not too far away, but I say go with your hands washed. :)

xV4oPelRUyVnoWB5SMMfkg.text: Great tradiation British pub! The full breakfast is £5, a great deal for a large amount of food. The way the place is run with one cashier shouting the orders adds to the charm in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. The full breakfast is 5, a great deal for a large amount of food.

qccGksYIb-pPD5sBRZMsaA.text: My work colleagues and I are regulars - we like to find excuses to come. The ambience is uniquely brilliant and the food is great. The steak pie is made in house and is a favourite. The sausages are not just the standard frozen cylinder types you get in some cafés but a decent butchers sausage.

88iHNIBt_6p-jHB574JLVg.text: London is expensive city for tourists, however Regency Cafe breaks the mold. It's where value meets true unadulterated goodness. You'll find an efficient staff who cranks out a full proper English breakfast with all the fixings and great coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. You want this, trust me.

dZ_aJo9Nl8IBHjMk7xhiyQ.text: Proper English breakfasts served all day, served quickly, served hot, served in a clean environment full of character and above all tasty and vfm.

DMZHe8RI8nMoYBSt_3RuIg.text: Five stars are deserved just for the birlliant vintage atmosphere this lovely cafe emits even when closed. A friend showed me the way on a recent walk, and I can't wait to go back during opening hours. I never thought proper greasy spoons would become such a rarety in London

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

N2pYO060BApkRXfRJy7z6Q.text: Lov the food and layout of decoration , very traditional English style, many locals go there

LAEofxQqCWKdsSaFknJeAg.text: Regency Café is a full English breakfast experience. I'm an extroverted person, but I get oddly nervous about ordering food at a busy counter, particularly as a US expat. This is probably because a) the whole restaurant can hear that my whiny American self wants extra bubble and squeak with no mushrooms, and b) the person taking orders has exactly five seconds of attention for my complicated order.It was an early morning business meeting, so I had other things on my mind to outweigh my counter fright, and the restaurant was mostly empty anyway. My valiance was rewarded generously with a heap of complicated order fry-up--complete with runny yolks (and charmingly runny hot chocolate).Don't be intimidated by the Regency. Be brave, ask for what you want, and you shall receive!

-h912IlCS9qndJSPSw6euA.text: Amazing food, excellent people, great experience.  Being an American in London for the first time I wasn't sure what to expect.  Everyone from the staff to the cafe patrons were helpful.

xl9MQa3iaHj3ZVCFSGpV2w.text: Wow. I was staying with the friends in Vauxhall and we were looking for breakfast. Pull up Yelp and what comes up as #1? Regency Cafe. Good reviews, nice pictures, close to us. Meets all our criteria. Little did we know what we were walking into.We must have gotten there at the right time because by the time we got our food and sat down, the line was out the door. Even if we would have needed to wait in a line, it would have been worth it. This restaurant is just about as cute and British as they come. I wanted to go back every day of my trip, but knew I needed to explore other places.You can get a pretty traditional full English breakfast but I opted for some a la carte offerings. My friends wanted to experience the full English and they really loved everything on the plate. There wasn't a crumb left when they were done. I got some chips (fries) with my breakfast because it was on the menu and really, why not? I mean, we eat hash-browns and home-fries with breakfast, so why not regular fries. I am seriously considering starting to order this in the states. If you are in London and want a great breakfast, go here.

zbIcbzGi1gAh4VK8KacHWw.text: Regency Cafe is a greasy spoon great place for a full English breakfast !!!!

slPKu8y5GKZUHYfI5X-t2A.text: Stumbled across this place while trekking from St James to Pimlico. This is a proper cold school cafe, staffed by real gents! The food is top notch and even offers liver on breakfasts (takes me back years). Great value and a great setting, bathed in history.......almost expected to see Michael Caine and the Kray twins walk in! Don't miss it if you get the chance. Kirk

Qs9btyPULjN-BJCGS39fyA.text: Very solid English breakfast. It's close to a lot of the sights, and getting breakfast is pretty simple - go to the counter, order, and then grab your food when it's announced. Sticking to the basics is simple - you get one over-easy (or as it appears to be called in the UK, fried) egg, British-style bacon, sausage, baked beans (certainly not something I've eaten at breakfast usually, or even in a while), and toast. The price is reasonable by UK standards (5.50 pounds), and you certainly get a full plate's worth of food. The meats are done well; in particular I was a fan of the sausage. Everything else was pretty standard by my tastes. Aside from the price (which is expensive to us Yanks with the depreciating dollar), I do wish we could've been served a simple glass of water instead of tea.All in all, though, a very solid breakfast joint, and I'd come back if I wasn't looking for anything too fancy.

MTQyYOWmtQWqZBWIsPdsyw.text: As one reviewer said, it's a classic English greasy spoon. Every few Fridays we head over for fish and chips. Clean tasting food, not greasy, with a great crunch! I'm still startled by the little lady's big voice. Arrive early (11:30-12pm) to avoid the line!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Friday's Special: Fish and Chips

_aYKiNOdShs4MonJ7xlGbw.text: Loved it. Old school but also cosy, seems like the perfect place for an authentic, quick and cheap English breakfast: sausage, bacon, eggs, beans and roasted tomatoes plus delicious bread with butter. The ordering experience is interesting, and given that the place is constantly busy, necessary. Would definitely have breakfast here again!

ZB0yitokr7WUvkaXS76RRw.text: "Set breakfast with beans!"I'll always remember hearing this shouted while I ate my bread and butter pudding. This is a real British diner type place where locals go regularly. We went for breakfast though we heard dinner was great too. It is a bustling place and not for someone who is super fussy. The bacon was awesome! Service is incredibly friendly and efficient.

q88v2Osb8pedNBia5FJQdw.text: Came in for breakfast on Saturday. This place was something of a letdown. There's a long line, there's not much choice in breakfast (it's pretty much just full English breakfast and Eggs Benedict). I got the Eggs Benedict because I had eaten sausage for 4 straight days prior. It was a very mediocre Eggs Benedict. NYC places would treat Eggs Benedict as a work of art. This place treated it as a chore. It did have a sort of charm, though, as did the man fronting the operation. He was a very English guy, with an unusual amount of charm, energy, and efficiency (yet still quintessentially English) He was taking everyone's orders and coordinating the kitchen folk, and seemed to love his life and his job. Stand-up guy! The food is prosaic, as is the ambience, decor, and the uniforms of the worker. Only in England could you find this, but it's beautiful. I will have to come back and try an English breakfast.

vJaQR1flLz89n3CY9X8hYQ.text: I was in London for a day. My brother had been here months ago because of the reviews on Yelp. Told me I had to stop by. I had the beans with egg and bacon with toast. Absolutely delicious! The host, Marco was an awesome gentleman. Thank you! Will be back again whenever I visit London again

WSygBEJ6dmAW5Sc9vW50UA.text: Often the places I try on Yelp let me down. This one is not even close to disappointing.Indeed, this place embodies why you come to yelp. To find awesome services.You've missed out if you don't visit this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Just as it should be
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. The special.

EiK1Wa6lTtWbpeALBQi52w.text: The place is terrible!! One of the worst place I ever been for breakfast!! Salty food, dirty glasses and rude staffs!! Very disappointed!! It's good value if you don't mind about the quality of food and service. The cashier/staff is also using the same hand for getting the bread and taking money from you.

bG-aOaYUHizll3Y2_NyccA.text: The Regency Cafe may very well have been the best dining experience that my wife & I had on our recent trip to London. It's an authentic no-frills English breakfast & lunch spot where you queue up and order from the counter, where a woman (who sounds like she belongs on the stage of the National Theatre) bellows out the ready orders. We had a traditional English Set Breakfast with "tom-ah-toes" and hash browns -- DELICIOUS and a great price!! It's an experience you shouldn't miss if you are an out of towner.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Interior of the Regency Cafe
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Regency cafe exterior
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Coffee, English Full Breakfast with tomatoes, toast and a split order of hash browns

EkkJll302SlV1T8jnXf68g.text: After multiple trips to London, this has been the best food, service and location I have found for a meal.As an American, the best part of going to the UK for me is being called "Love". Don't ask me why. It is likely a combination the wonderful sense of familiarity you get when a term of endearment is sent your direction and far too much exposure to British literature, TV and movies.Not only was I called "Love" by the proprietor, this place FELT like love. It felt like home, like I had just sat down at the table of Nonnatus House, or made my way in the The Burrow, or that I could soon be accosted by Mrs Bennet telling me that Netherfield had let at last!Sadly, I was sick when I found my way into this slice of heaven. AND YET, I had what I would call the best egg sandwich of my life. Thick slices of white bread I wanted to rest my head on, and eggs cooked to perfection, with fresh ground pepper and salt. I have dreamed about this sandwich almost daily since having it.I love that the tea comes out of a big urn, and that the menu is simple and hearty. I love that it feels like you are part of the family when they call your name to get your plate. I love EVERYTHING about this place. It will become a mainstay of all my London visits, and it should be a definite stop for you, if you're in the city.

ScqC_irSOZltGkaA6GpkGA.text: Short walk from the Doubletree hotel. Traditional English breakfast. The owner runs a tight ship, which is appreciated! You order your food THEN find a seat. Don't try and find a seat first, you'll get yelled at! Lol Food was great! Quick service! Line can get long, but if you are looking for a traditional English breakfast and coffee at a low price this is the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Scrambled Eggs, Ham, Sausage, Beans, and Toast!
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Coffee

WUTYR_qcO3HCW1lTrHE_xg.text: Classic, traditional, cheap/affordable English breakfast. What else could you ask for?Visiting London for the first time and I just had to try a full English breakfast at least once. Worth checking out: I'll definitely come back!Great customer service - even though I could barely understand their infamous British accent... So embarrassing on my part. People there were so nice and cool! Get in line, order your food, get a table, and wait until they call for you when your food is ready. Just that simple. I came early on a weekday (around 8:00 am) and there was no line whatsoever.Ordered the set breakfast with the egg, sausage, bacon, beans, and toast and I added black pudding for extras. The food was good and homey. Good portions; I barely finished my plate. So simple, yet so good and satisfying.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. English Breakfast with Black Pudding and Tea w/milk

WL_xegVN7VhauQSDlqyI-w.text: I don't know what I was thinking- I have very few pictures of this place. Wish I took more pictures. Their English breakfast is delicious. And the best bang for your buck. No actual vegetarian option, so I did a lot of adding and switching with my other half to create one: beans, has browns, eggs, bubble and swueemThere were a bunch of options, most of which I didn't understand, but they were patient as I fumbled through choices for coffee or tea, with cream & sugar? toast or bread (bread is lovely), bubble and squeak...? What? As you can tell from above, customer service was great. It's kind of confusing because you don't get a number. They just call out your order and you go and get it.Since we were clearly from out of country, we just kind of sat down and wandered up every time something sounded like ours. The lady just glanced at us and shook her head until it was ours, and then she finally said, yes, this is yours. But not horribly. Just matter of fact. It's definitely an experience worth having, even though there's not really a close bus stop. The food was well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Tea- no cream or sugar. Toast & bread. Bread was different. Soft. Great texture.

UEIWy2qpFJNnvBxMvKziwA.text: Had the set breakfast and added black pudding and hashbrowns. It was outstanding! Small cafe with friendly staff. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

DkmAsaozpmbdHbGELwPMnA.text: Wow! This is the spot to have the traditional English breakfast and it does get very crowded after 8:30 am in the morning! We went and got the traditional bacon, bread, beans and eggs, my bf got tomato instead of beans and both broadened our horizon! They are good of course but it is the experience of eating traditional English breakfast with Londoners that we love and cherish a lot. If there is another opportunity I will definitely go back to London and go to regency cafe again! Oh please note this place is cash only but does not shadow any beauty of this little historical great restaurant!!! There is even a picture and autograph of Al Pacino on the wall, how awesome is that?!!!!

koBPgrSuKQbRWPDGLjCSQA.text: This place was incredibly good. Unlike a few of the other reviews, I actually didn't have any problem with the service. I came here by myself on an early Monday morning with two weeks' worth of luggage; I had just gotten off of an overnight bus from Paris and was absolutely famished. I ended up sitting at a 2-top table relaxing and planning out my day for a good three hours, and never once did I feel rushed by the staff.I did already know what I wanted to order (breakfast deal + hashbrowns), but the workers were still friendly and one thoroughly recommended the black pudding. Everything was absolutely delicious! Ratings of individual foods:Black pudding - 5/5 (love that stuff)Hashbrowns - 5/5 (served super hot and so yummy, but let's be real.. when are hashbrowns not good)Tomato - 5/5 (always a sucker for a good grilled tomato)Egg - 4/5 (fine. it's an egg)Sausage - 3/5 (a little oily and salty for my taste)Toast - 3/5 (always meh in my opinion)Bacon - 3/5 (also very oily and not hot enough)Coffee - 6/5 (don't know what it was about this coffee, but it was absolutely STELLAR! they sprinkle some sort of cocoa / cinnamon on top that takes it from good to great)Overall very impressed with this place. You'd be hard pressed to find a better place in London for an affordable and delicious English breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. set breakfast deal + hashbrowns + black pudding

vAsX3idH1XPCvdHKFLdpJQ.text: Fantastic food, fantastic service. The line was really long, but it went really fast. We are already planning on going back during our stay. Highly recommend!!!

6005a9KhP_PQ-VU7Q0oVBQ.text: Cheap food and delicious. Can get super busy in the mornings and lunch. Always have to wait but service and turnover is fast. For breakfast i get their ramen with spam and egg but for lunch i love their baked rice with chicken mushroom cream sauce

UTlPxPom9dbeAiWzpLAiaw.text: Walking into Regency Cafe was like stepping back in time. This 70's diner serves simple meals for all day long. My bf and I had an early tour to get to on our last trip to London and Regency was on the way to the bus station so we stopped by for some breakfast. We were surprised at how much we liked this neighbourhood gem that we came back again on our last day. As a Canadian tourist, this is one of the few restaurants that served affordable food without breaking our vacation budget. If you're coming in the morning, it's filled with locals and construction workers because of how early it opens. I loved sitting by the window and people watching while I ate my first meal of the day. Being a tourist, it's always interesting to see how others start off their work day in a different city. If you're coming during the lunch hour rush don't even attempt to hold a table - you're not allowed, there will be a sign saying this. When I say lunch hour rush, I really mean it - expect a line, sometimes extending outside the doors and around the corner. You're welcome to come grab lunch and dine-in, but I would watch the time to make sure that you're not overstaying and being respectful of other people who want to sit and eat. There is no table service here. You order at the cash desk, and wait for your order to be called. I don't believe they call numbers so I would recommend that you remember what you ordered :)

yWi9BAwfQkT6ATxuf9wq9A.text: Walked for miles to get to this café. Cash only. No alternative. Gruff attitude. ATM in nearby shop not dispensing cash.

ujTYR2P2k_yFUG6CNKT_fQ.text: Honestly, this place is amazing! The staff was great, food was outstanding and the price cannot be beaten!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Best English breakfast ever! I'd come here everyday if I could

OCVcKgOSxMif6CSvVJSUnw.text: Amazing food and staff. The lady taking orders has the voice of a powerful engine ! Awesome I really enjoyed the time here . Must visit again

ZzW6QmvNowG5l7gtPQrDCQ.text: I didn't really anticipate this place being my favorite meal in London - but it was pretty much no contest. After some decently pricey meals in Europe, Regency Cafe is an absolute steal for some ridiculously well done breakfast. We ordered a big plate of breakfast and an carafe of OJ (which was only 50p!!! Why am I being charged like 8 dollars for orange juice in the US?).Our breakfast had Eggs, Hash Browns, Sausage and Bacon, Black Pudding, and Tomatoes along with a side of toast. It was a little too much for us particularly because of how heavy everything was, but it was DELICIOUS.Sometimes I don't really know why breakfast can taste so good. Everything is simple. But they absolutely crush it with their execution.I wasn't sure about black pudding having never had it, but it was quite delicious. I'd compare it to eating sausage with a little bit of an earthiness to it. The tomatoes were key as the acidity helped with all the heaviness of the greasy meats. Everything else was just great.I'd definitely encourage people to try and show up early. When we left a little after noon or so, the line was stretching up the block with probably 100 people waiting. We managed to arrive when there were only 20 or so people in line. Seats open up almost perfectly in time by the time orders are made and filled, so don't panic if it seems like a booth won't be available in time.

nUGkFedEBMotgJnefS4bJA.text: This is such a traditional English diner. We've never had "bubbles and squeak," or "black sausage," before. I liked the bubbles and squeak! Service is quick. This is great for your typical diner breakfast! Cash only!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

X5AC1u7gOPNJqIFxMsBJtA.text: The food was good. The lady behind the cash register is making a show when is yelling for the orders. It was a first time for me to try Black pudding and it's not for me, but the rest was good. For 6£ you get egg, bacon, beans or tomatoes, sausage, toast and tea/coffee. Its cash only!

pkjO7v1pS8qsE529iCWq-Q.text: I'm probably gonna get a ton of hate for this, but the English breakfast here was way too salty! I would rather shell out a couple extra £s for something a little more decent. Sorry. :(

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Set Breakfast Deal (5.50)

mrl4USAe-HWmZ3E1FEe07g.text: Inexpensive English breakfast (at 6 GBP)This is obviously quite a popular place--for that. CASH only

8kNcPVDvLXDzWz3ggYfcjg.text: More happening than the great revenge scene in Layer Cake - solid fuel for working people. Had no issue navigating the engaging cafeteria ordering scheme - it was a great experience and the food was on point. Orange yolks are signs of quality sourcing! Well worth navigating to when in town.

tpnm-Q2j4yF1DWuZt3rcSg.text: Came here for brunch at around noon and there was already a line out the door on a Friday. Note that this spot is CASH ONLY. Wait in line to order and then find a seat. They will call your name once your food is ready. We order the set breakfast deal with toast, tomatoes, tea for 5.50! Also added hash brown and it was so good! Definitely recommend checking this spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

FfNsbxIVWwV0xsHBM2zuWw.text: My Mum sent me a link to The Regency about 5 years ago, which just said "JUST HEARD ON RADIO THIS IS GOOD PLACE FOR BREAKFAST." So, the next time she ventured into the City, off we went to the backstreets of Pimlico to find out how much we could rely on Radio 4's recommendations. Turns out, they really know what they're talking about.It's incredible. A beautiful cafe of a certain vintage, it's all the better for not having been updated. It's unbelievably popular, but I've never struggled to find a seat (and we've been back a fair few times since). The clientele is a mixture of tourists, workers and locals, most of whom look like they're regulars, which is a great sign. I've only ever been for breakfast, but as it's the best full English I've ever had in London, I assume the rest of the menu is also fantastic.Every time I've been with my Mum we've had the same argument - she is convinced that the counter staff wear microphones, as there's no way they can project their voice like that (she's wrong). When you go, you'll know what I'm talking about. Just trust me when I say, definitely order before taking a seat - hell hath no fury like the Regency staff scorned.

MzOAOfq9Is5SU5n3JzXZIA.text: Amazing! Felt very much like a place where locals go. And it was delicious! A must go breakfast/lunch spot while in london.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Sorry we were hungry!

JL_GFNp9pgVM31y3oIefNw.text: This place is ridiculously good.  I had the English Breakfast and it was divine.  The hash browns were dark and crispy and the eggs were fantastic.  Can't go wrong with some tea either and I actually enjoyed the beans as well.  Would highly recommend a visit here next time you're in London.

lytr04MURkOoLnCDjrvvdg.text: Very affordable, good value cafe with the standard British breakfast and lunch food. I had to come here for my last lunch in the neighborhood before we moved offices to the other side of town, because I hadn't tried it yet, and I'm glad I did! The lunch crowd is rather busy, so you may need to share a table with someone else if you're only one or two people, but I didn't mind too much.Many tasty-sounding choices, but I settled on the vegetarian version of the eggs benedict (normal but ham-less) and chips (because according to reviews they are fantastic). I really enjoyed both, but made the comedic mistake of putting sugar on my chips instead of salt. It took me a while to realize my mistake, too, because the salt shaker was hidden - I thought at first that the chips were just really sweet. Then I finally found the salt shaker and had the second half of my chips in a sweet-n-salty style. It's interesting, you should try it sometime!

P5M-bp1qpZ-Vr_USeCs0AQ.text: Food was awesome and so was the counter clerk! Despite having a line out of the door, he still made the transaction very personable and funny. Quick food and service! Friendly staff and reasonable prices! I would definitely go back!

4IJyAtnLFyaTCpFi_4qZUQ.text: This place is definitely Greasy Spoon.But the food is so so good! Watch for the hostess. She has the most impressive voice of them all! I was so taken aback that I forgot to order the dessert I was planning to have along with my meal. I got the home made steak pie and chips and it was very very good, as far as British food goes. It's limited seating, yet very popular, so be prepared to share your table with others. I went on a weekday mid morning and they were busy, but the line wasn't out the door and they got through very quickly.Cash only.

JTCQbSxPouroSkoANu8beA.text: The English seem to have very low standards for breakfast. My bacon tasted like fried liver, the coffee was in no way coffee.

ZoU4axznnAiXaBOMPJQ4PQ.text: If you are looking for a great English breakfast for cheap then this is the place to go! Has a small diner feel to it and you can't beat the prices. Seriously the best fried egg I've ever eaten in my entire life.  My only regret is that we discovered it on our last day in London and not on our first. You will not regret eating here!

gefwqdPu_O4-eNOWvRTk4w.text: One of the best full English in London! Always a treat to pop in before I go to Tate Britain.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast at The Regency

UYC5fiHLMAK5XYeMdyiZzw.text: This cafe has never let me down !The best brekky in London and last of dying breed . well worth every penny and quality on a plate .Took a friend there the other day who was telling me about his local cafe , who then had to admit it's the best brekkie he has had :)))))))))))))Try the hash browns ( My fav )or anything else for that matter is quality produce and can actually taste it .well recommended .

EGixliUrFtJX55kiAItzjg.text: This place is deliciously good ans so welcoming. One of the major complaints we have had at a lot of the restaurants we have tried here has been the service. This is not the case at Regency. It's a simple restaurant with an amazing owner (guy at the register) and great overall vibe.The owner patiently waited and helped us decide what to eat. It was affordable (cheap actually for London) and there were so many things we wanted to try. We had baked beans, the bubble and sqeak potato, black bloody sausage, regular sausage, eggs and coffee with milk (comes with a dab of chocolate powder melted) . All delicious and hit the spot.Tables fill up fast here, but everyone is so nice that is here. We want to come back and try other dishes. Perhaps we will!

06z87bi-PYKFyEDl00BIgg.text: When I was in London I found this place through yelp and thank goodness! The most authentic British pub, it has a history, run by GREAT people with good energy and the food is amazing. Not only that, the price is great and you get a good amount of food too! You def won't leave hungry!If your looking to eat a traditional British meal while visiting London, come here! You won't be disappointed. **bangers and mash  **Shepard's pie **bubble and squeak***coffee

MH0GR5gdU3Db3sJqTuCsuw.text: Incredible. Queued outside on Saturday at 10am but had food within 15-20mins - when I left people were still queuing out the door. But great atmosphere - I enjoyed waiting and watching. The food itself is very good - beans, bacon, sausage, egg, beans. Delicious bread, solid cup of coffee. Staff are friendly; it feels like you're in London in the best way possible. I'll definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

EL9V_b6YY45nmTAvikdsFw.text: An amazing iconic caf! You enter to the sounds of a well projected below of orders up by jimmy. Both him and his female counter part have the most amazing support voices that ring across the hoards of taxi drivers and builders.But don't be mistaken their food is great. They make the best bacon sandwiches of all time. Amazing bread and lots of brown sauce. That is the key. You can sit in the same seat where Daniel Craig beat the man with a teapot in the movie Layer Cake, while enjoying our fry up. A must visit Caf, I that exists

yRL3FnHQ03sI8pIrVY5YEw.text: Great place to eat a typical english breakfast ! Good system of service, very quick and the man taking order is awesome. I def recommand this place if you're visiting London!

dEDdfxSbtYTQdKH7CpK6CA.text: We absolutely love this place. Great food, fast service. What more could you ask for?

GLqt5pQwSQ2c19okiNB6uQ.text: This place is great!  The portions are off the chart and the traditional English I got was spot on. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

5-8cKOS7g28WfjARxar2Aw.text: Great full English! Be ready with your order and follow the rules - don't grab a table until you have ordered. Eat up and leave. We didn't think there would be a table for us given the length of the queue but there was. The system just works. The food was out quick, hot and delicious! Will definitely be back.

w2lB8s2ZEf7n2pqMKat1YA.text: Really good, we had the burgers and chips. We were really impressed, everything tasted amazing! This place stays packed for a reason, seriously worth a try. We hope to go back and try their breakfast!

6c5ehSMLbkcQB5HHj3WsNw.text: Really fast paced restaurant and you order first then seat yourself. I like the atmosphere it really gives me a good london breakfast feel to it. The breakfast is definitely different from the american style diner breakfasts but I am probably more used to the american diners.Ordered the standard breakfast meal which came with bacon (looks like peameal bacon). I usually hate beans but these beans were pretty good. Picked the bread and not the toast and it was very good. Was just bread and butter.Not sure what the brown sauce really was but t went well with the meal. Great for vegetarians as there was beans and grilled tomatoes and of course eggs :) Choice of tea or coffee as well.

IAb8rCw0-PsuqMrmMD2ABA.text: Wowza...what a find.  Want to know where the locals go for breakfast.  Look no further.  Don't get me wrong.  You'll find your share of tourists like myself.  Regency Cafe is no secret and definitely shouldn't be.  The food is brilliant and highly affordable.  Don't be afraid of the long line or grabbing a table.  Trust the process.  It goes quickly and seats will be available for you once you're done ordering.  Get the set meal, add all the sides, pay 9 gbp, and enjoy the rest of your day.  Seriously, the amount of food is massive and probably one of the best breakfasts I've ever had.  They were out of bubble and squeak the day I went so my sides consisted of black pudding, hash, and mushrooms.  Everything on my plate was cooked and seasoned perfectly.  I can't speak highly enough of my meal.  I was also full all the way through dinner time.  This spot is a MUST if you're in town.  If you want real English breakfast, make a stop here.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

MPfyK5QbftGjNiSe1HTMWQ.text: Review #900! Regency Café was one of the shining stars in my London dining experiences. I forgot whether I found them from searching on Yelp as I was finishing my tour of Buckingham Palace or via a bunch of lists of Must Eats in London, but they are well worth a trip!One thing to note, don't come on a Sunday! They're closed on Sundays! We came back to London last year (2017) and had just finished visiting Buckingham Palace (again! We had the one year pass that barely expired that day.). We walked to Regency Café and thought we heard the familiar loud bellowing from their female employee that calls out the order. Oh, we were wrong. They were closed that day. =(So let me take you back to our first visit in 2016. We came close to 2 pm and it was still pretty packed, though the queue to order was not too bad. We ordered the steak pie with potatoes and vegetables (£4.30) and the chicken escalope with half salad and half chips (£5.80). Make sure you order first before trying to grab a seat. It worked out that way as more tables freed up after we were waiting for our order. We got our order shortly and dug in. Having not eaten since that morning, we delighted in discovering the food was great along with the price. Hence, we tried coming back the next year and didn't coordinate our trip plans accordingly with their business hours. We'll try again on our next trip to London!

4eVXOwxf_8KD2M-h2iF2Dg.text: Extensive variety. Could be super busyOrdered the set breakfast which was served wellFor additional information, they are cash only and I am reducing one star on account of them not having a restroom . Which food location doesn't have that ??

SGStgDgFHPmEV0cvoF-qJA.text: As soon as my boyfriend and I landed in London, we were cranky, jet lagged, and starving. We decided to come here because it was walking distance from our place and we were craving a traditional egg breakfast. I ordered the eggs hollandaise with spinach and my boyfriend got some kind of English breakfast platter with eggs, mushrooms, sausage, beans, and toast. Great food at a reasonable price!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

et_9ZgTvyS-J9oMPvThlYQ.text: Great experience tucked away from the bustle of tourists. Full english is the only way to go. Order first then take a seat and be sure to know your order before you get to the counter. It was amazing watching the staff work keeping track of everyone's order while keeping the line moving.

vgIKMf3zBxtUC0RRuYgoHA.text: After a long night of drinking, and getting out of The Bletchley so late that it was impossible to find an open restaurant, we both woke up famished (and a bit hung over, really). My husband found The Regency while I was fixing my hair, and we decided the quick walk from our hotel to the restaurant would do us some good. We knew we needed something filling, having only eaten one meal the day before, so we had high hopes for the English breakfast.You have to place your order at the counter - and this place is cash only, so come prepared. The guy working the counter was a seasoned pro with a good sense of humor. He took our order, called out the names of the people whose orders were ready, got us our coffee and popped bread in the toaster for another order as we stood there, money in hand.We did both go with the set English breakfast, adding on the black pudding because we're pigs. That kitchen was going at a breakneck speed, slinging beans and eggs at a record pace.The food was hot and filling, and fairly standard. There are several tables inside, but the only one that was open when we went to sit down faced the door. It was a cold blustery day, so every time that door opened, we froze a bit. Nothing can be done about that, but it was unfortunate.We did leave feeling much more human than when we walked in. We definitely got our money's worth with the amount of food and the speed at which we were served. It's a nice little neighborhood shop that seems to get its fair share of "usual" customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. English Breakfast with added Black Pudding (90p)

329yJebwj9UimN1elJX7vQ.text: Cheap comfort food will never do me wrong. I ordered an egg w 2 bacon (£2.70) with mushroom, fried tomatoes and black pudding (extra 90p each). I can't believe that I'm going to say that I love this bacon more than bacon back home in the states. It's thicker so you can actually have a chew on the meat, it's delicious with the huge mushroom slices they serve.The black pudding surprised me because I've heard what it's made of but thought it tasted just like potatoes with oats inside. This place is the perfect venue to try traditional British food if you're visiting, especially for those on a budget.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

hi3iK9PMQY75LgZzk29FSw.text: My goodness if I was in London for another week, I'd come here for breakfast every morning.It's got that local diner feel and you can get a full and satisfying meal for under 10 pounds. I ordered the full breakfast that came with eggs, beans sausage, toast and coffee. I also ordered the black pudding. I was eating all this myself and almost didn't make it. My left over was one slice of toast which was tasty but I couldn't fit anymore in my belly. There is high turn over so you don't really have to worry about not finding a table. I didn't see anyone share tables as one person left for another person to come in and settle down. Make sure you order before getting a seat! It's worth the minimal wait.

J_LCfdWNznfCzjOZis0gtA.text: Your popular local neighborhood breakfast spot in London. The menu is on the board behind the cash register. There will be a line but be ready to order as soon as you make it to the cashier. They move quick here. The rules are, you cannot take a seat until after you order. So there's no saving tables. Once you've ordered, take a seat and remember your order. The cashier will yell your order when it's ready for pick up. You go through all this trouble because this place has the Best English breakfast!!! Cash only.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Full Set with bacon and tomato. Add ons are the hash brown and black pudding
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Chicken pasty. Not good. A lot of dough with much inside.

0SlP03HJ0b1XePimOJEYsA.text: A true working-class establishment. The staff are efficient and get food out at an impressive pace.A great spot to go to for a proper English breakfast. I ordered (along with a lot of people in line) the set breakfast which is a convenient customizable breakfast with all of the essentials. I also got the white coffee (coffee with cream).We were in and out pretty quickly. All in all a great place to experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

DOaLyNG8ErCE4yYfSgoCkQ.text: You want a proper fry-up? Look no further than the Regency Cafe! I recommend all my friends to go here for your typical full English breakfast.This is the real deal: their breakfast is no frills but oh so good (and oh so many calories haha). I've cooked hundreds, maybe even thousands of eggs in my life and ate even more but somehow the Regency's fried eggs taste so much better than anywhere else. Is it the eggs? Is it the cooking technique? Someone please enlighten me!When I was here recently, I noticed how unique this place really is: it fills up quickly in the mornings and it attracts all sorts of people, from construction workers to men in fancy suits mixed with a lot of tourists. All of them stand in line and are united in their love for this breakfast institution. How often do you see that?Maybe I should write a letter to the world leaders to tell them to take the Regency cafe as an example on how to unite people but in the meantime: Move over Avo on toast & granola! I am eating at the Regency Cafe!

UJNXmnav_3AYv88zIrDy4Q.text: Oh goodness. I was so close to not trying out the traditional English style breakfast because I'm not a huge fan of breakfast in general. I also don't care for beans. But my husband and I decided to go because -- come on now, look at how popular it is! Look at the reviews .. how can we forgive ourselves if we didn't give it a try?We went to Regency Cafe for some brunch before we left London so we got there at around 11 am. We were lucky that when we got there, the line was not long. Keep in mind that you have to order first before you sit your butt down. No such thing as saving seats! My husband and I got a breakfast plate with bacon, eggs, sausage link, tomatoes, hash browns, blood sausage and tomatoes. We also decided to share an eggs benedict, as well as an orange juice. The breakfast plate comes with coffee or tea and it is an AMAZINGLY good price. I think it was maybe $6-7 USD? It comes basic (bacon, eggs, tomatoes or beans, sausage link) but you can add hash browns, blood sausage, etc. They also had lunch menus on the items if you aren't interested in breakfast. And they have a different special each day. Forget the eggs benedict -- the breakfast plate was where it's at! Everything was so DELICIOUS. It just hits the spot -- filled with savory goodness. The only issue is that it is a bit on the heavy side of things and after a while, everything becomes really salty. I had to take a pepcid after the meal because when a meal is too greasy, I start getting nauseous. I would probably suggest you sharing the plate with someone else. Oh and do try to come before the rush. The line gets REALLY long. It literally goes out the door and down the street. It gets especially busy during lunch hours. You'll see business people coming here to grab food on their lunch break. Regency Cafe is definitely the place to come for the proper English breakfast. Cheap, delicious, and quick!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Set breakfast with bacon, sausage links, eggs, tomatoes, hash browns,  and blood sausage
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

DAz3t3g55rAcXAqKr1GM_w.text: I'm a breakfast person so this was a must visit for me, all i wanted was a traditional English breakfast. We took the Underground to St James station getting lost along the way, we exited the wrong part of the station as usual. When we finally arrived this place reminded of an old school breakfast joint, English style. I had the eggs, toast, sausage, ham and beans. I'm not big on pork and beans type beans , but not bad. I ate my wife sausage and ham so I was in heaven. The lady(maybe owner) had a set of lungs, when your order was done you could be down the block and hear her yell in her unique way, but very nice too. Good food for a good price, a rarity these days.

TwMFdIoyi1YIwrmI0NaJxA.text: You know it's a great place when the local crowd is willing to wait 45 minutes in line to order their food, which is affordable, tastes great, and made with care.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. They make a fine fish & chips here!

x2uRKaOecyftN2nCZRh1Xg.text: Great place to eat a full English Breakfast...I encourage you to get the special with a side of Bubble and Squeak...Bring Cash as no CC accepted.

lfjPstQxa5LN__UZFd3Geg.text: Why 5 stars? Because this was my first meal in Europe and it did not disappoint.   ---   ---   ---For the rest of my life, I'll never forget:"DOUBLE EGG, BEANS, TOH-MAH-TOE"As you enter the facility, you hear some guy yelling out orders at the counter as they're ready. It's a bellowing voice that echoes through the halls of our the building and your brain. It's like going to breakfast AND the opera. Much to my shock, as we get closer to the front of the line, I realized that it was a woman yelling out orders! It was shocking and impressive that she was able to go so deep with her baritone. And the absolute best part was that she would go from her gladiator to a gentle/normal voice so seamlessly when taking your order. "...BEANS, TOH-MAH-TOE, and yes, you had the hash browns as well?" It was amazing. If you're reading this and don't understand why I've spent all this time talking about this woman yelling, you just need to see it for yourself.Aside from the entertainment, the meal was great too! And cheap! I ordered the set breakfast, which was bacon, sausage and egg - while adding on beans and toast. Two things stood out to me about this: bacon in Europe is different than bacon in the U.S. and in a good way. It;s large and thick, more so like ham than bacon. But it's very flavorful, and I definitely wish we had bacon like that over here! The other thing that stood out was that I'd never had baked beans for breakfast. I wasn't sure if I'd like it, but I ended up being a huge fan. Maybe it's something I need to try on occasion while I'm at home.This was one of the cheapest meals we had in Europe and definitely a memorable one!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and mushroom pie
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Set breakfast with beans and toast

afPiaX47Vm5zzMkO2EhJTw.text: I cannot say enough good things about this place. Amazing prices, staff, options of food, etc. My husband and I ate here 2 different mornings because of how much we loved it. We got lots of food for both of us and it was always around 10 pounds. Way cheap. I loved the toast, hot chocolate, fresh orange juice, cute little shop, beans, bacon, it was all good. They don't wear gloves when handling the food, so they touch money and then your food...so that was my only complaint.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

0pOi-_EJux42Znkjhe7fPg.text: This was my first greasy spoon experience, and it was a good one. I got the set breakfast with beans, toast, and tea. I also added black pudding for 1 pound, totaling to 7 pounds. I tried to add bubble and squeak but they were all out, which was disappointing. I went at around 12, and there was only one person in front of me. By 1, the line was out the door!The employees were all very nice, the food was decent, and it was reasonably priced. This is a great place if you're looking for standard English food.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. set breakfast with black pudding (7 pounds)

E5V_76bFJwWYYM66-xNUtg.text: The theater of this place is amazing. Queue out the door at all times yet somehow there's always a table available after you place your order. The woman at the counter shouting when your order is ready. How she's able to make tea and toast, take orders and yell out when they're ready is something to be seen. The cooks in the back with griddles full of eggs, bacon, sausage, bubble and squeak, black pudding and more. And, of course, triangle hash browns. We loved it so much we went twice during our 4-day trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

NSSWX_jIyBVgX0wL6FKWvQ.text: Yuuup.  This is the breakfast joint from Layer Cake, for the scene where that guy who has no idea what's coming to him is gorging himself on the full English breaky.  This place is more of a novelty than a serious place for breakfast.  It has a nostalgic cafeteria like feel with quick hot and filling food.  But not my type of breakfast or lunch.  And that's coming from a gal who likes her full English from time to time.  Good for when you are on the run or want a quick lunch with your co-worker.  Sausage was fine, but very burnt and bacon was perhaps the saltiest I've had by far.  Lady working the counter had an amazing voice belting all those orders.  Part astonished and tickled, at least the experience of it all made up for food taste.

SgUhuwCansFDBHVB0LcPQw.text: A friend who has been coming here for the past decade took me here one morning, before I had to begin a day's journey back home. I recognised the interior from various TV programmes and photoshoots that had taken place here. The interior is what you'd expect of a traditional British greasy spoon, a look that has been hijacked and reproduced by overpriced hipster eateries across the city, but you can always tell an original! The prices here can't be beat, and though its a greasy spoon, vegetarians aren't forgotten!There's little more I can add to the glowing reviews above and below. Delicious, generous portions of food, served efficiently, and GREAT value. I'd recommend getting here in the mid-morning, before the queues. Best chips I've had anywhere in England, and I adore a good chipper. As you take your fill, drink in the classic interior and the characters sitting at the tables around you. Be polite, don't gawk, don't take too many pictures. Afterward, admire the nearby 1930s Sir Edward Lutyens' buildings on Page Street, and stroll to Tate Britain to take in a dramatically different facet of British culture.

R2jhO6mSUnruiXY0a4JgGg.text: Hands down the best breakfast I've found in London after having lived in and traveled here for over 15 years. Such a traditional English breakfast with a locals-only atmosphere without the pretension. A few straightforward choices will lead you to a solid and satisfying breakfast that deserves a visit no matter where your journey starts.

v88F2OGsxeRq2chZt6eVtQ.text: Oh man, this place is so inexpensive and delicious and full of locals and it's been in movies and the lady yelling out orders has a magnificently loud bellow...go here. Avoid the Westminster tourist traps and pop in here for a full English breakfast or fish and chips or steak and kidney pie.

c0ti4_GZtbaLj5pysk8lCw.text: We were brought here by a friend who  lives in London on a Saturday morning. We had to que for 25 minutes to  be served but people seemed very willing to wait. Don't think I'd wait that long again if I was going here but I would return if there was a shorter questions.  Food was good and at a fair price

83Gq08rSkoySDxw8lzkcsA.text: IF YOU want for quality, consistent and excellent food especially for breakfast, dine in here at Regency Cafe. Being a foreigner here in London, my girlfriend guides me to experience an English cuisine and here I got everything on this plate so genuine. Their coffee tastes great set with beans, toasties, hashbrowns, sausage, pudding - all you have it for £7.30 to have your breakfast.See and you'll have quantities of food on a plate at a convenient price. I notice as well the ambience of this shop as vintage and you can look back its humble beginnings. Alisha also told me in our conversation that Layer Cake was filmed here, I wonder if some locals do notice that anyway.One of London's great food scene that any foreigner, like me, shouldn't miss. All staffs here work very efficiently and friendly to their guests from all walks of life. I'm sure that I can take another dip of coffee here the next time around.

TnnSxcBSYLcc4TBe7O0TLQ.text: I came here for breakfast. Food was very good. Service was fast. I would come here before 9 am to beat the breakfast line. Pay before you sit.

DkMhOHKKWBLRFGTee3wkIA.text: Came here after landing in London for the first time we were very hungry wasent impressed at all. This is just a place to have food and eat that's it,  don't expect too much quality of the food but you get what you paid for, I didn't try them on breakfast. Staff is nice, food not good very average to bad. If you can stay away better.

g5CFkgeyU0Psufxq4TYXmA.text: Simply simple and great breakfast.  There is no fanfare but only genuinely made authentic good food.  Good vibe with customers from all walks of lives (businessmen, construction workers), locals and tourists. I had the full breakfast and added black puddings.  The tomatoes were so so good.  Black puddings were great.  Crusty breads as well.  Decided to go for the tea (with milk) over coffee and that was the right decision.  So good that we went for a 2nd round of tea!  My husband had full breakfast and added hash browns... Which was great also!2 breakfasts + 2 extra teas = 15 pounds.  Hard to come by in London!

QpnVT6Zl0aPm37QH_tLjeg.text: This place is a hidden gem I recommend to my friends when they are in town. Nothing beats eating a great English breakfast with the locals. It is a small place, but so worth it! Generous portions as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Yum! @ Regency Cafe

nyBjvaUPIHGelal2CR-Chg.text: I wanted a "traditional" English breakfast, and saw this was a high rated eatery, so I decided to check it out. I got there about 15 mins after it opened and the place was very busy already. I ordered eggs, bubbles and squeak, hash browns, sausage, bacon, tomatoes, and toast.Everything was amazing.Have a hangover? This breakfast is greasy, it would be a great remedy....but also don't  eat here if your tummy is weak or you are on a diet. Everything was cooked perfectly, and was really good. I will say, I was not expecting the bacon to taste so different from that in US. But still really good..It was about a mile from the eye of london, but totally worth the walk.Yum!

gHO-Cf9ipwuLQq86uTrh3g.text: Quite perfect breakfast and diner actually. I was a little intimidated at first because it looked heavily populated with locals (or at least regulars) but when I stepped up and gave the main guy my bumbling order, he was very patient and kind. After that (and asking where we were from which pleased him) I felt as welcome as anyone in the place. Then came the food. When I picked up the plates, the locals at the counter said "THAT'S a breakfast." Yes it was! Eggs, tomato and mushrooms, hash, sausage, bacon and toast! A proper full English just as I like it! Delicious and filling! I wish I lived here to frequent this place much more. Quite possibly the perfect diner!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Full English: scrambled eggs, hash, bacon, sausage, tomatoes and mushrooms!

R8SLdYgDGHuTALiEde9L6g.text: Regency Cafe is the quintessential, greasy spoon - a great place for a full English breakfast.  For about £5, you get an egg, bacon or sausage, tomato or beans, toast, and coffee or tea.  A cheap and filling (and meaty) way to start your day!  Also, the women behind the cashier's voice is magical.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Full English breakfast

VrBc6PR4opkqIAJAwOE7kw.text: Verdict: When in need of proper/authentic English food this is as good as it gets!Pros:- Proper and authentic English in all regards. Food as well as ambiance.- Price. Especially when quality is taken under the consideration. - Great and several options for those who are not into full English breakfast. I hate beans in tomato sauce!- The kitchen efficiency and organization is fun to watch while waiting.- The cakes: b&b pudding or layer cake are to die for. Perfect to share!- The set of lungs on the cashiers calling the orders to be picked up: they could hold jobs at the Opera!Cons:- This is where tourists need to go but sadly it's way off the tourist usual tracks.- As tourist or newbie you need a manual first on how to order or behave.- Almost always busy so not for the timid who can't share tables with strangers.

FK9KyU4p51Fu9DM-PJz6hQ.text: You walk in and the place has this great retro vibe to it. You order at the counter and wait for your order to be called out. I ordered the English breakfast and it was fantastic. The price was good as well (about 5.50)

HbiO7XrV2b3x0d1RUhNOgg.text: Really loved this place! Went with a friend today for the first time and we really enjoyed our meal. I had eggs, sausage, beans, toast and coffee and she had a cheese sandwich. Both came out really quickly and we're very tasty. There was one guy working the counter but he was really efficient and friendly. He made coffee, took orders and seemed to be running the place. The place was a mix of office workers, construction workers and tourists but the place in general did not feel touristy. We went on a Thursday. We will definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

VH8uFhlAoL3D66xBUJEXKg.text: My husband and I went here for a typical English breakfast after seeing all the good reviews on yelp. It was great. The food was good and came out very quickly. It was not very busy when we were there but they still seemed quite in a hurry to take our order and get the food out. It was a fun experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast with black pudding added. Cheap and good.

qjMpCzdpSG3LOIteU5iP5A.text: This is one of the last of a sadly dying breed; the true English cafe.  This isn't some silly gastropub or fancy "nouvelle cuisine" nonsense. This is genuine English food at it's very best. Perfectly cooked and incredibly filling and delicious comfort food for very little money.  I've never had a better breakfast in London at any price.  Period.My ritual for arrival in London: Get off plane, get through customs and immigration, go outside, smoke cig, get my butt straight to the Regency Cafe and eat my face full for something silly like £6. If you're not there for breakfast, order the pie.  Londoners know this, but it appears that us yanks have bombarded the reviews for this place so this is for the Americans:O R D E R    T H E    P I EI prefer the beef, but I'm told the chicken and mushroom is also perfect.  Get it with chips and beans. Eat it. Revel in the perfection that it is. No trip to London is complete without a trip to the Regency Cafe.  For those of you who live in Westminster, I am truly envious. Oh yeah, read the other reviews for the ordering process and it's cash only.

gpSlI8MFR0lvAqNtmfYffw.text: Quite easily the best London Caff fry up in Zone 1...Every stereotype is fulfilled: value for money, diversity of customer, strength of the tea and portion size! Plus the service is tremendous, anyone that can remember your name and say farewell like you were an old friend in a packed cafe should be congratulated. Anyway onto the fare:The set breakfasts are something to behold;With Sausage, perfect bacon, fried egg...(They aren't that 'set' and can be tailored quite a bit with ) choices of beans versus mahoosive tomatoes, toast or bread etc!It should be noted that the extra Hash Brown isn't just for one it's for a whole potato worth of them! A must for any London visitor or resident alike, grab a milk-bottle full of orange juice to wash it down with at the wall table.Trivia: The Regency is where the Layer Cake tramp bashing scene was filmed!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Two set breakfasts: amazing!

vI6r3njXIizzknytsMyo8A.text: I love this place as a breakfast institution. Please follow the rules and order FIRST before sitting. The woman behind the counter is amazing. You gotta get the fry up--- calories be damned. Its a great mix of Londoners, locals, and tourists, and don't be afraid to share a table

hSKniNehKhPNG7hQJHVICA.text: English hospitality at it's finest. You get such an authentic local breakfast diner. The staff is very friendly and welcoming and the food is fantastic. I had eggs and chips. I also had a coffee too,great stuff. When I go back to London I will make this one of my stops to get some good breakfast.

DJwFx_TnKRYPGXYJDrHWtA.text: This is a famous greasy spoon right in the heart of civil service country - the Westminster/Victoria border - and just a few minutes from Channel 4. It's black and white art deco interior has seen it act as location for various TV and film productions, most notably in Layer Cake and there is the usual mix of patrons spread across the social strata - labourers next to office execs next to students. As for the food - there's roast trout in quince jam, pheasant roulade withonly joking, I said it was a greasy spoon so what do you think they serve? And it's absolutely fine for that. More interesting to go for the decor and hustle-bustle atmosphere than the food but then, when that's all you serve, you have to distinguish yourself somehow.

nRQqgNpkOyN54r6DKIvKNw.text: Sometimes only a fry will satisfy The Regent Cafe is what people think of when they imagine a 'proper greasy spoon'. Decent priced, decent grub for the hard working men and women of the post war years. Formica tables, gingham curtains, a rattling coffe machine and cabbies sucking up industrial strength cups of tea. OK it's 50 years on now, but the Regent hasn't seemingly changed much from that socialist post war ideal, albeit that the brickie can't have a smoke after his ham, eggs, fried slice and the cabbie squeezes in amid more monied Pimlico residents and trendy Asian tourists (the latter location spotting from photoshoots in Japanese Vogue and appearances in Brighton Rock.) A full breakfast with tea, toast, extra hash browns and black pudding comes to a princely £6.80. You'll struggle to finish it, even if you have just come off a building site. Plump properly porky sausages, decent (if slightly too salty) bacon and bright yellow eggs belie the low price.

8quiQuCM-8aBGGD3E1mcJg.text: I was a frequent visitor to the Regency Cafe in the Nineties when I worked around the corner. At this particular place of work, there was a lot of after work boozing going on, such that it did not seem to be ten minutes from stumbling out of the pub at past eleven, waking up and being on the way back to work in the morning with a thick head. A quick stop at the Regency to get fuelled up would help see me through the day, indeed several colleagues remarked that I was the paragon of effectiveness, all thanks to the Regency and despite the heavy nights. Eat in or take out. My favourite - bacon and egg butty, or sausage and egg butty, the sausage neatly sliced lengthways to ensure ease of consumption at one's desk. Eat in you can't beat the fry ups. Probably still the best cafe in Westminster.

a9QChlvHhmSW6foZDQ36uQ.text: My absolute favourite cafe in London. Woohoo indeed, this is as good as it gets. The Regency is decked out in its original Edwardian tiles, both inside and out, so that when the baritone voice of the lady who takes your order rings out to the kitchen staff, it echoes around the interior like a cavern. Its the normal satisfyingly greasy fare, all cooked and served in a classic fashion by the clean and proud-looking staff. Always busy, the clientele are a mixture of builders, suits and students, all tucking into their bacon rolls and egg'n'chips, knowing real quality when they see it. My only complaint is that the Regency is located too far from my Hackney home to visit more than occasionally, and that it's opening hours don't stretch to the evenings or weekends.

ctunR05G0RGdaJSDe1w59w.text: substantial meal for a reasonable price.  if you're a foodie, this is probably not the place.  but if all you require is the basics, this is your place. the coffee was rather watery, but that's my only complaint.

YLpfs9kpRMsPVppJxr93PQ.text: glad i read the reviews before i went.  the place does indeed have a "soup nazi" feel to it.  and yes, that tiny woman yells the orders so loud.  impressive they know exactly who ordered what even when the food orders are the same.  very affordable, huge portions that keep you full all day.  it was my first english breakfast and i loved it.  the hash browns and sausages are sooo  good.  we went every morning and 8am and never had to wait in line.

7p_jsm9tEnR7GxWfjj0uPw.text: I would not classify a greasy fry up as one of my meals of choice, therefore it took years of walking past the Regency Café several times a day before ever experienced it from a culinary point of view. This is what you would call a builders café, but probably due to its location in the heart of Westminster alongside those customers who have just left the building site around the corner, you also et a fair helping of suited local business men and women who cannot resist the café. It does definitely have a certain charm about its Edwardian décor and unpretentiousness. Even if only for the comic factor of being sat amongst yellow jacketed and hard helmet wearing men and hearing "Hannah's egg and beans" being called out over them all, I rather like the Regency Café.

vigoEknDH3uJeW-VPDQjTg.text: Regency Cafe was the first place I was taken to eat when I first arrived off the plane from Heathrow.
