And I still remember that sleepless morning fondly!What better introduction to the English way of life than through a typical and traditional London cafe, indulging in a lovely full english breakfast?For £4.99, a full english breakfast consists of toast, tea, 2 eggs, sausages, bacon, and your choice of baked beans or grilled tomatoes (Beans please). Juice is an additional charge. Not the cheapest of breakfasts in London, but the quaintness of the place and the size of the breakfast is absolutely satisfactory enough!Popular with the middle-aged locals, this gingham and formica furnished cafe is also popular with film buffs, having appeared in many British TV Shows and Movies.Regency Cafe is also famous for the way in which you are served your order. No table service, it's pay as you order, to which, when ready, your meal order is called out by a raspy thorated woman with a voice completely unlike any other. She's well-renowned and it's worth going just to hear her unique call!The food is ready in unbelievable time, so be prepared to eat and leave! Not for lazy weekend brunching and paper-reading, although you can try if it's not too busy!

ag2JbdJUiiuOIuCPKsM4WA.text: Proper British0style caff halfway between Westminster and Victoria. Everything you expect from a great greasy spoon - big portions, good solid fresh-cooked food, a great line in fried breakfasts, and tes you could stand your spoon up in. Highly recommended. Oh, and if you've seen the film Layer Cake, with the delicious Daniel Craig, this is the cafe where XXX and Morty have a very special breakfast with Freddie Hurst.

8WzRvnHcR8UPRWjBf_RIpw.text: Good lively atmosphere in this well known bustling cafe. With all the usual menu choices you'd find in a cafe, as well as a daily specials board. The orders being called out is famous! Very fairly priced considering its central location.

HXfJcWcePJ4Ti7LB1q7sOw.text: This is a brilliant example of an English 'greasy spoon'. It's located not far from The Tate Britain so if you're planning a visit make sure you plan a stop at this traditional English cafe too. The interior is all tiles and formica tables, great food ranges from any combination of eggs, bacon, sausage, chips, beans, fried slice etc that you can think of. Strong tea, good toast and at lunch time, anything from pasta to scampi, pies and school dinner style puddings. They shout the orders are they're ready which can be disconcerting when you're standing in front of the person shouting it, but it all adds to the atmosphere!

BJDCv_Z38oYlL0joeoCJjQ.text: I really liked this cafe, so homely and really friendly lady. Hot Chocolate was Cadburys and made with milk.a bargain at just £1. Being open in the evenings is brilliant as it's difficult to get honest British food at a reasonable price anywhere after lunchtime. Noticed a lot of London cab drivers in there too.and they know where the best places are !Didn't have anything to eat this time but food looked great so I will be back for a good traditional meal with a pudding and custardyum.

3FOrQB0vYKLk2h8R_KJANA.text: The pub was packed and had a weird rule. Basically you can't sit until you order. I told my husband to save us a spot and the cashier basically shouted that we can't do that because it was the rule etc etc. He was quite curt but his efficiency made up for that exchange. He was great at his job and got the orders out fast. The food was fantastic. I'm not a fan of British food but I loved it. We had sausage peameal bacon beans and grilled tomatoes. The toast was ok the hash browns great and you get 3 for 99 pence. The coffee was so good. I asked for white and he basically made me a latte. Overall this place lives up to its rating. I'd definitely recommend for someone who wants a great English breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

mo7hwVM7y_cjlCFthdwJtQ.text: Love love love this place! It's truly a hidden little gem. Tucked away in a neighborhood away from the noisy city, I found this place on Yelp and made my way for a full English breakfast. The staff is nice but the food is terrific. Get the full breakfast with black pudding with beans. The tea is delicious And the lovely little lady behind the counter has a ferocious voice when she yells out your order. I love it and went early enough on a Thursday morning (11am) to beat the crowds.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Love this lady! She's a riot
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Full English breakfast with tea

b-dgVq2x8ogLrcRtW_Ahxg.text: Good food, charming atmosphere.  Best part of it was the gent behind the counter, he could have come out of a novel. Extremely polite and pleasant with a deep booming voice to call out orders that were ready, you couldn't help,but imagine backstory for him.The food was good, classic English breakfast fare.  I would certainly make it a point to stop in here at least once on future trips to London.

5XRjQdG8Rx7V9b7c3GuILg.text: Outstanding place! we loved the English breakfast they had, the meal was colorful, the homemade sausage was tasty, the beans are great! A must definitely place to check if you want to get a good heavy english style breakfast. A+ to the cashier guy!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. (Big) English breakfast for a cheap price! A place to visit if you are nearby, good starting place for tourist.

XLFKZZbRCG6APzoSTiWRfA.text: Yes it's quite a distance if you're not already in the area but boy is the food and prices oh so GREAT! The menu is pretty straight up: either tomatoes or beans with your full english breakfast or toast (I can't remember the other option) LOL but it was crazy good. You have to pay before you sit down which is good because it keeps non-eaters from occupying tables which eating patrons need. Plus, it ensures that queues are kept to a minimum. Will definitely visit this gem again when in town; btw, our visit was the 2nd week of Nov. 2017 for reference.

dMZXVM08EqSZZ4Nwucwf9g.text: Excellent cafe. Unchanged decor since the day it opened in 1946. Cheap and cheerful. Great food with a smile. Formica tables and framed photos from the days of yore. Good coffee. Every cafe in the country should be like this!

VgQFsQ_OaG-8zMEQQSurhw.text: The rave reviews are not hype. This is truly an extraordinary spot for breakfast. It would be worth twice the price, but let's be glad that's not necessary.My one comment on previous recommendations: I would gently steer you away from the hash browns, unless you're really fond of pressed-patty, somewhat McDonalds-style hash browns. They're perfectly fine for what they are, but they are what they are.Everything else, though? INCREDIBLE. Best in class (and even well above it).Update: My five stars are for breakfast. I've been back for dinner now, and it's solid but less spectacular diner fare. Come whenever you want: just order from the breakfast menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. "Set breakfast tomato hash browns!"

rG89IGflQinq1ooNWqoQPQ.text: Affordable classic British staples from breakfast to pudding with a few pasta entrees thrown in. Particularly enjoyed the black pudding and sausages. Nothing fancy, just solid greasy spoon food made in house and at a really good price for its location (where else in Central London is quality fish & chips from four choices of fish 6.95?). Long lines constantly, for this reason.

EiDbBGcAbxwOhIJ87xNqxA.text: Super great food and super inexpensive. Typical English breakfast. Great local feel. Went for lunch and breakfast and both were tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Escalope with Chips

uOK2Lm0rfjEWhp7eSJqB0w.text: Great atmosphere and great food. We had 2 breakfasts with additionnal hash browns and black pudding with coffee for 12.80. All is very tasty, only sausage is not as good as in Poland. ;-) Come before noon if you do not want to stand in the queue. Make sure you order before taking a sit. Cash only.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

NNWwZz7UiALTtRNAWTL91A.text: First stop to get food during a trip to London. My friend and I split a set breakfast with an added side of hasbrowns. Definitely just the right amount of food for both of us and at a great price. This place gets pretty busy. After I had placed my order first there was a long line behind me, but food comes out fast. Definitely would recommend!

flB5uEjtY5MFQ60UY2cqlg.text: I really miss having this kind of neighborhood greasy spoon feel back home. The food is good, even with me not being a fan of English sausage. The woman at the front has an amazing power of vocal projection :). VERY affordable, as we had the set breakfast, and the sausage/beans/eggs breakfast and OJ (which is great btw), at about £9,50 if I remember correctly... But definitely under £10.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Set breakfast of Eggs, Bacon, Sausage, Beans, Toast and Tea

uDKqhC6jc2Humo272mfK6A.text: This place was so good! I checked it out for breakfast with my boyfriend and we went back the next day because it was so good! I loved how they called out orders so old school like a North American diner and the baked beans are a must! Food came out so hot and fast this is a definite must see!

CxNcyM4L6CTdw0ASXaUm5A.text: Well well well.  It's a travesty that I have worked pretty much round the corner for 3 years and never dined at this amazing establishment.  The queue alone outside the door for breakfast demonstrates the appeal of The Regency Cafe.  We decided to go on a Friday morning which when we arrived before 9am the queue was already out the door.  Good signs.  The system here is rather than jumping on a table and waiting to be served you are to queue and order your food and then find a empty table.  An odd system you may find but it works very well.  Once we ordered the food it arrived very quickly and my word - value for money is achieved!  I ordered the set breakfast with hash browns and bubble and squeak.  I can confess only one of these extras is needed.  The portion sizes are amazing and the breakfast was delicious.  I thoroughly enjoyed the eggs and sausages as well as the orange juice that came in a milk bottle,Very old school and a great touch.  This is a great British cafe with amazing food and minimal fuss.The service is great and I would recommend to keep your ear out for your order!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Set breakfast

rot-qHkVi5O8Hiw9t55AYg.text: We were jet lagged and looking for a place that opened early enough that served a hefty breakfast. Luckily, we were within walking of Regency and braved some stormy weather to trek over to the cafe. I ordered the eggs, sausage, tomatoes plate and it did not disappoint. It was so hearty that we didn't feel hungry till late in the evening (pretty much went from 8:00am to 6pm without eating -- only a couple cups of coffee to ward off the drowsiness).Lastly, I'd point out the economical value of the meal. After coffee and tea with our meal, the total was under £15. For a city where an average meal is like a highway robbery, I'm glad a place like Regency exists.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

t-YbKGqFLgbOk2xp47MO_g.text: A good local and worth the travel. they have a system which works really well. You can only sit down once you have ordered your food and then at this stage, you have to wait until your order is called out.The breakfast is great an you can mix your order to your own preference. Good quality food is made throughout too. Make sure you remember what you order.On certain days they have their specials, such as Fish n Chips on a Friday. besides the breakfasts the steak and kidney pie is one of my faves.

FDeS6JDVOiL4JuJXyPyxAw.text: Great.The real English diner.Fresh food, huge portions and affordable prices.The coffee they serve is filtered, that is the best coffee you can have while eating their delicious food.You need to get in line so you can place your order and then you can grab a sit, sip your drink while waiting for your order to be ready, everything is served freshly cooked. Loved it.

F8jN-u2806gLBL9Wui7BPQ.text: So after years of knowing about the Regency Cafe, my best friend and I finally paid a visit.Things were definitely in full swing and a long queue snaked to the door when I entered at 8am. I joined the queue and thankfully this moved very quickly and before too long I was putting in my food order. There is a menu, but I think pretty much most people go for the standard English breakfast. If you are going to do this you have to take a few really tough decisions -Tea or coffee?Bread or toast?Tomato grilled or not?Once this is out of the way, it's plain sailing. Choose your seat and wait for your toast/bread order the surface and go back and grab that! Once our breakfasts surfaced, we tucked in. I've eaten a lot of full English breakfast in my time, but this has to rate very highly up there. It really was the perfect blend of just enough salt just enough grease without being too over the top. One of my biggest complaints with cafes, is that they use crappy ingredients to cut corners, but I was happy with all of the produce that they served here.As I visit more and more places around the world, I truly despair of the corporate homogenisation that is occurring throughout the globe. What happens when finally the only place to get coffee in the UK is a Starbucks, Costa or Cafe Nero? What happens when the only place to get lunch is a Macdonald's or a Pret? Even the small businesses that were once quirky, are now becoming more and more prevalent. Places like the Regency Cafe are the true gems that we have as they offer great value for money, individual style and friendly, if somewhat shouted service!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

09BuzfsoV4KAi1k8a89gUw.text: I'm struggling to find the intense appeal of Regency Cafe. Part of me feels obligated to rave and gush about it because it seems like a London institution, but I can't get on board with that 100%. You have to wait in line to order before you can sit down at a table. That's not a problem since the line moves at a tolerable rate. I think it contributes to control of their limited table space. There is certainly value in terms of the amount of food you get for the price. Coffee or tea, eggs, tomato or beans, sausage, bacon, and bread or toast. A massive plate of food! Maybe I'm just not accustomed to this hearty of a breakfast, but it just seemed extra greasy and extraordinarily heavily and nothing particularly special.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Beans, egg, bacon, sausage, toast. Very salty~
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Where you place your order and pick up your order

mBoErJTkE2_avlD7CIFSLg.text: Very friendly host. Efficient and streamlined. A good start for any day of the week. Enjoyed the eggs, chips, fried tomatoes and coffee. Easy on the budget. Remember...cash only!

oJmmsRwjkrLO7IaIAZQDfQ.text: No frills review for a no frills place. Long line that moves sporadically, it's certainly just a workingman's cafe, that everyone else found out was great - so filled with all kinds of people including families tourists, locals, etc.They come here for the food. Well done normal items - we had the full English breakfast, add hash browns. Great choice, it's a ton of food. Nothing is spectacular, but everything is done well. This is the best breakfast sausage I've had since moving to London.Be prepared to wait, be prepared for a little chaos, but overall worth the trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

IPg2LRewX2dUY3MuqAzNWQ.text: You're telling me that you can get a full set breakfast here that won't break the bank in the heart of London?! This place has long lines out the door, but it is extremely worth it for the opportunity to eat here. You can get a full set breakfast with sausage, bacon, a fried egg, hash browns, two slices of toast, and baked beans, all for the low, low price of £5.50.Be prepared to listen for your order from the lady behind the counter (who has an amazingly loud voice) and make sure you don't dilly-dally in line. This restaurant is incredibly efficient and anything that causes you to make them slow down will get you a scolding.

KqG60GoykJRhCT0UIPZrMQ.text: Is the food delicious? No doubt. Might be the best hash-brown I've ever had. The sausage, the toast, all amazing. Is it worth getting yelled at for no good reason? Absolutely not.Why did I get yelled at, you ask? I made a huge mistake, I suppose. I ordered English breakfast with some toast, but I had no idea the toast doesn't come at the same time as the breakfast. When I went to pick up the breakfast platter, the guy who's dispatching the food asked if I also ordered a side of toast(furiously). Said yes, and he pushed the toast plate over and yelled "I've been shouting for you to pick up your toast for the past 10 minutes!". OK, I'm sorry that I didn't know every rule in this restaurant, but hey I brought cash, I waited in line patiently, I said to-maa-to instead of to-mae-to... I made an effort but that did not prevent me from getting scolded. I can understand how they are trying to maintain the quirky culture, the attitude is a part of the charm. But I just want to have a nice meal without hearing so much shouting in the background, and I'd prefer not getting yelled at. It's just not the place for me. Sad face. It's really too bad because I loved the food and I lived so close by, but I never went back.

r9UV4zua0xq_Vl0aiZEK-w.text: Finally, after several years of hearing about it, I made it to the Regency for lunch today.It was all I had been told, a very British caff with a pretty big variety of food. I decided to get the homemade steak pie and chips. The man who took my order was very adamant that I should have vegetables - but from what I could tell, they really only have peas or beans, and I didn't want either. He was also insistent that I had gravy. I caved and said yes to the gravy, and he conceded that I could just have half gravy.We grabbed a table and about 5 minutes later, I heard the call of 'steak pie and chips for the young lady'. Young lady? Don't mind if I do, thanking you!So he was right, it was nice with the gravy. And half gravy meant that my delicious chips weren't made all soggy by a ladle of gravy. The steak pie is the only pie they make on-site, and it's really nice - the meat is tender and there aren't any fatty bits. It's pretty plain, with the filling being some sort of tomato-based sauce (American readers, it reminded me of swiss steak). It was a solid choice!So yes, for the café it is, it's a 5*. Charming service, quality food, and at a good price.

SuoaBkNLhLkdl3QvSaKRoQ.text: Would recommend this place.  It was quite busy when I attended, however service was great.

tImiCedTU0NxXoexuW3NqA.text: The highlight of our week in London.Honestly, this place is brilliant, typical greasy spoon. And they do it damn well.We went twice, the first time there was a line out the door (queued for about 15-20 minutes) the gentleman who I believe owns the business works at the front counter, I had the set breakfast with beans and tomatoes with hashbrowns. It comes with tea or coffee, and bread or toast.After you order, you find a seat and wait for your order to be called out.After reading reviews I was worried about the apparent rudeness of this guy, but honestly, I think he's great!He remembered my name the second time I visited, and was joking around with me.The food itself is brilliant.It's the kind of food you just want to eat while curled up in a blanket watching TV.Will definitely return without a shadow of a doubt the next time I'm in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Front: Set breakfast with beans AND tomatoes, hashbrowns with tea and bread

ECJc1QmTM_2eRbznxGR7jw.text: A small little restaurant where you first place your order before getting a seat. This place gets real busy with locals and other people that are visiting, tourists. Line for ordering moves fast, but if you want to get a seat.. there might be a wait time. On the other hand, the lady who takes your order and calls you over was amazing. My friend ordered and she said the lady's voice was regular but when she calls out, it was a whole other tone. Decent experience. Inexpensive meal and filling. Food may be a hit or miss, but still good enough to try for the experience of being in London.

ghbQYQb-AH-yxoDGQjWv9A.text: Loved this place! Came here on a Friday afternoon for breakfast at around 11:30am. The line was not long then, but about 20 minutes later it was out the door.I had the breakfast plate (eggs, sausage, toast, tomatoes, and hash browns)...it was very good, quick, and piping hot.My boyfriend had the fish and chips, which he said was great!

hKSGmeG46DwVfPbNzVMP9Q.text: I asked for utensils, said it several times. Then the owner kept saying what like he didn't know the word. I said you don't know the word? He said yes I do. Then he called me a wanker. I called him out on it. Very rude!

OyZ7LP86vPx4SRJsoyHLfQ.text: Took one star off because they only accept cash and 2- the guy was a little rude. Not being from there I wanted to try a full English breakfast but I don't eat pork or beef so I ordered that just without meat. He was like don't tell me what you don't want tell me what you do want l, kind of in a rude way. I don't know what's in a full English so I read from the menu on top. He also pushed my bag as I was getting my money out. I didn't know it couldn't be on the counter. My bad. Anyway the food was good, toast was great and love the beans. Price wasn't bad either but I had to go take out cash.

UxPLplXTIoHfIuP6s2XANQ.text: Absolutely delicious breakfast. We stayed in a hostel near by and stumbled upon this little cafe while exploring one morning. They have a system down pat that serves you quickly. "Set breakfast" is right around 5 pounds and you get a traditional English breakfast. I'll certainly make a stop here whenever I'm in London again. Would recommend to anyone.

Tb9G4IPjz61M25XlKvcdMg.text: Huge recommendation if you like authentic english breakfast and locations that are also attended by locals. Its vibe somehow reminded me of Katz Delicatessen in New York. An absolutely no-frills restaurant - no recommendation if you prefer modern & hipster places. Only cash payment!

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom

q8T5wp1eEKBicjLF09ePDA.text: LOVED THIS FIND.  I had earmarked this place after seeing glowing Yelp reviews and, after a delayed flight, getting lost, and waiting in line for 40 minutes... I was so happy I didWe both had the breakfast set with an additional order of hashbrowns.  It was delicious AND the entire place was bustling with local customers.  If you get the chance to go-- DO ITFYI, the establishment is cash only

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast set (toast not pictured) with beans and a side of hashbrowns (90p extra)-- delicious!

8lcz7gLb4ZzqFnhAisxuzQ.text: Fast service, very welcoming manager/owner. The toast was a little burnt but I'll let that slide considering that everything else was great. Don't worry if there are no more seats/tables. Right when you finish ordering, there will be a table that will vacate. I promise you!

eo5XFb-nbDmG0lBDm-FqKQ.text: Absolutely terrible. We wouldn't come back if they paid us. I've had dozens of English breakfasts in my life, and I've been to nearly hundreds of greasy spoons, and this is on the bottom ten of them. There's a queue, which usually signifies good food, but not in this case. People come here because it's famous and/or convenient, rather than the food itself. The staff is rude, and they literally yell at you. The food is standard at best, the setting and the decor are lacking, and there isn't a moment's peace, because the whole time there's a staff member yelling out orders at the top of their lungs for people to come and pick up their food. If I were in the military, or in prison, I imagine it'd be something like that. Just absolutely not worth going to, at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Average English breakfast.
Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Worst Eggs Benedict I've ever had. Sauce was basically meted butter with some salt. English Muffin was stale. Rest of breakfast was average.

JInNzHeGmjde_fd2ss2kVw.text: Any time I am in London I have to go to Regency Cafe. Incredibly affordable and an excellent breakfast. I have always had excellent service. Definitely the best greasy spoon in London.

GOhA3Mawo9J9LX1X7m83Bw.text: Pretty good. Classic British food. Highly recommend. The space is cool! Waiters are nice. The food is ready fast. Great food!

KOQ7GqMGtLWuJAZf2Qf2IQ.text: As an American, when visiting London, my English boyfriend would not let me leave town without having a Proper Full English Breakfast.  While neither of us are locals to the London area, going to Regency made me feel like I was.  It is the kind of place that brings together all walks of life, there were construction workers, business people, students and just a dash of tourists thrown in for good measure (but only a dash).  It is a place I can imagine going to once a week for a coffee and a hangover cure.  My boy and I both got their full English with add ons, me getting the Bubble and Squeak and him with a black pudding.  I got tomatoes on mine and he got beans.  Both were delicious, both were fantastically inexpensive (which is always welcomed in a city as expensive as London).  Even my man, a guy who knows his way around cooking a hangover full English to be sure, was seriously impressed.  Nothing fancy here, just solid, tasty food with an in-and-out fast food kinda attitude.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Full English with tomatoes and bubble and squeak. Get yourself some of that b&s!

uKviXv777kuD7rT-sinpNw.text: Good for that morning fry up. A heavy night before and an all day meeting nearby on a Saturday, I decided to treat myself. Bring cash and get in line, do not save a table for your friends, do not hold the door open, know what you are ordering, you have enough time to plan this while in line. Oh and listen for your name, do not make the cashier angry by having to call it multiple times.The breakfast is hearty and arrives quickly, I went for a full English, with beans, toast and tea, with added extras of bubble and squeak, black pudding and hash browns. To be honest the bubble and squeak didn't do anything for me, but the pudding and hash browns really hit the spot. Eggs were cooked with proper runny yolks and the rest of the plate was went down a treat. The idea here is to get in, eat and get out, it's not fine dining, nor are you entitled to keep your table for ages. As greasy spoons go, it's good, but unfortunately a little too far for me to go for breakfast on a normal occasion.

ruZ0s5n1N8y0AXsH92_f_w.text: This is a great place. Small, simple, fast, and excellent food. The Old traditional English breakfast was as good as it gets. Don't go there for quiet ambiance, go there for simple, great food and friendly staff.

JA1Dd5-T250T92_oTXqvoA.text: I was looking for a decent full English and was originally going to go to The Breakfast Club, until I heard that they specialise in American breakfasts. I'm glad I chose the Regency Cafe (near Pimlico station) instead.The set breakfast goes for £5.50: egg, sausage, bacon, beans or tomato, toast or bread, and coffee or tea. You can add extras like hash browns or black pudding for 90p each. You'll likely have to queue up at the counter, place your order, grab your own utensils and find a seat amongst the suits and construction workers, then listen for your order to be called. There are specials throughout the week: shepherd's pie on Tuesdays, curry on Wednesdays, and fish & chips on Fridays, for example. There's quite a selection of other dishes as well. The cafe feels like its stuck in another time--nothing seems to have changed in decades, and that gives it a certain charm. While you wait, have a look at the photos on the walls showing the cafe throughout its history.The food was exactly what you'd expect in a full English. Everything was tasty, and it was served up remarkably fast. I will say that the fried egg looked somewhat plastic-like, although its appearance belies its taste, and that the bacon was rather on the salty side. Certainly worth a visit.

CzuO-YDiv-XAlMLj26c46A.text: Before our trip I did a bit of research on yelp and told my two friends we had to come here since our rental apartment was nearby.  The first time we came it was busy but it seems it's always busy.  The line moves pretty quickly, and you must order before you sit or else the man taking orders will let it be known.  It's a little embarassing.  The menu seems limited but everything looks good you want to try it all.  The English breakfast is standard:  sausage, bacon, beans, tomatoes, eggs.  It's all very good and a good start to your sightseeing day.  I love their chips aka french fries and hash.  The second time we visited I ordered chicken and mushroom pie.  That was very comforting considering the cold awaiting outside.

JXr2TGZrMYrTjYv9URmxfA.text: Solid English Breakfast. Not too greasy. Good coffee. If you want to go low carb, they can throw swap some avocado instead of potatoes.

wZxsy_7wsQI66yG0zic0Lw.text: The only bad thing about Regency Cafe is that it's in London and I'm in California. I was traveling with a friend, whose favorite meal is a traditional english breakfast, so after reading a ton of yelp reviews, I decided we had to come here the morning of our flight back home. Good god did we leave happy. It's a super casual spot, but you'll see a wide array of clientele, including guys in suits and guys in construction hats. The food is impeccable and crazy reasonably priced considering how expensive food can be in London. We had the traditional english breakfast, with tomatoes, hash browns, mushrooms, basically everything extra you could get. We also got the special of the day, shepard's pie, which I couldn't resist even though it was breakfast time. I dream about this place and am devastated that I can't hit it up every Sunday morning. Please, if you live in London, go for me, ALL THE TIME.

Wr4LeqIzahsiFbe0fqJLLw.text: 25 minutes in line, looked and smelled like a great greasy spoon. FAIL! At the register realized they don't take any cards. No sign on front door to that effect but they have a Yelp loves us sticker! Will take care next time to read location specifics that aren't always accurate...

KwumPvO_tK_f3EL4sagsfQ.text: Not knowing what a "greasy spoon" is (I'm American), we ventured to this breakfast diner hesitantly. I'm so glad we did! We split a very large breakfast special. The sausage was amazing, the bacon was thick, the eggs were fresh and the hash browns were dripping with grease. If ever in a need for a hangover cure, this is the place to go. Albeit we were yelled at for taking too many napkins, we saw this as all part of the local charm.

photos.caption: Photo of Regency Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast Special

GTt7KU1joK8OjwRKQtdZ8w.text: Good value, breakfast is just under a fiver but greasy...I have experienced better!

AO9FNTa4bg-7FYD9zeUlPQ.text: Lovely little coffee shop  they serve the most delicious English breakfast I've ever had. Eggs and bacon were perfect and the coffee  freshly roasted.

hYyfOaOa4tt-uwgcn15y6A.text: Ate breakfast here each morning I was in London a couple weeks ago. The food was great, the coffee was hot, and the voices of the workers were priceless. As others have said, they seemlessly alternate between a soul-vibrating "ENGLISH BREAKFAST WITH BEANS" announcement, and "how can I help?".If you're in the area, you have to go here. You get the feeling that this is what London used to be like - you know - before it became like every other megacity.

wbJv6KtxgcfG_udwjJOYwg.text: Brilliant, gorgeous old school cafe.  (incidentally it was also the setting for the scene in Layer Cake where Daniel Craig tips tea over the tramp's face).

w01xdtN-r3z0J88jJW3RRg.text: This place is as authentic a greasy spoon as it gets. I live in the area and only get to go at weekends but from what i've experienced the food is great, especially if you've dragged yourself there with a hangover. In fact i reckon it's the best place for a decent brekkie in the area!The decor doesn't try to be 'retro' or kitsch' - this stuff is originall! The cafe is so visually striking it has also starred in Layer Cake and a VW ad.

E83Us7NUYHYE8QKUXtQ8Aw.text: After reading all these great reviews, I had to visit this restaurant. We came around 6pm and ordered our food around 6:30, we had the chicken raviolli with potato and side salad. This filled me up and next time I am in Regency Street, I will definitely try some of their other meals as well. They looked really nice

HUh85ZGW9MXSgK7ORmCYUw.text: I am a fan of the Regency Cafe, especially their English Breakfast. I always find something wrong wherever I go but the breaky here is awesome, The eggs, bacon, sausage mmmm yummy.

zDq8nZfOXKwfw8oeJHsH6g.text: Solid English breakfast for a very reasonable price! Come hungry because it is a lot of food.

gcaOXWz-E64aws6bxD414A.text: "CHICKEN, CHIPS & PEAS" This is a fantastic British cafe.  I'd call it an old school diner myself.  Lots of charm to this joint that looks as if it's been transported from a movie set with actors included.  You can call it Edwardian but I don't know what the heck that means.  Wait in line, head to the counter and place your order.  Mostly diner type food; burgers, pastas, omlettes, roasted chicken and everybody is having chips (fries to all you stateside wankers).  When your order is ready the same guy who took your order yells out whats ready in a booming baritone voice.  CHICKEN, CHIPS & PEAS.  Great stuff.I think some of the locals were pissed because I was sitting down before ordering my food, a supposed no-no.  Damn Yankees.  Once I got my chicken, chips and peas I realized why the place was so damn packed.  A line was there when we arrived and the line was still going strong when we left.  The chicken was crisp yet moist and tender inside, covered in a nice pan gravy.  The chips aren't your daddy's french fries, they're more like roasted crispy potatoes.  If you've eaten proper chips you know what I mean.  The gravy had a sheen and tasted home made.  I gooped up every last drop on the chicken, the chips and the peas.  Proper British food to start off my all British day.  Go you Irons!!!

UFFpooMOQjfcKw8FjnfJYg.text: Definitely worth the walk away from the "touristy" areas. Other reviews have captured the atmosphere better than I can after just one visit - but I will be coming back here every time I'm in London, I guarantee it. The shepherds pie was good but the Cornish pasty was absolutely to die for. Good pastries, too.

CiSwehQ1_NXB8WtXZLSfUw.text: Vintage formica. Love it. Great atmosphere and NOT a tourist joint - mostly locals and tradesmen (plumbers, gas fitters, etc) getting fuelled up in the morning. You should see the number of small vans parked outside in the morning! All the more reason for tourists to come and check out a genuine piece of London in the heart of Westminster. Bacon sandwiches are made wth slices of bloomer bread i.e. not a factory square loaf and bring your false teeth if you wear one because the bloomer bread is lovely and chewy. I still cannot get over watching people order and eat chips with their fry up breakfasts in the morning (before 10am)!!!! Queues at lunch time are long and a testament to the Regency's popularity. Check out their displayed boxing and football memorabilia too.

Oq--YfMa_2rBikEpDUbleg.text: I'm happy to report that the Great British Greasy Spoon is alive and well in Westminster. The Regency Cafe is certainly no secret, with a queue that stretched out of the door for the duration of my visit. Inside, tiled walls are decorated with movie memorabilia (although strangely no mention of Layer Cake) and the noise is almost deafening. What at first appears to be total bedlam is, in fact, an amazingly well organised operation. "How does this work?" enquires an American lady, "What do I do if there are no seats available when my food is ready?", "Don't worry, there are always seats ready" is the confident reply from the waiter. He was right. Quite how this places works so well I can't quite fathom, but work it does. At the counter a diminutive lady shouts out orders so loud that I can't hear myself think. Well cooked, hearty grub flies out of the kitchens to feed the queuing hordes. The Regency Cafe is a real find, and I loved it. I suggest you try it too - there will always be a seat for you.

M2a_OCowDuom3nvT5dIq9w.text: Just awesome. The opposite of tourist fare.  Best possible English Breakfast experience--and I didn't even know about the Layer Cake scene until getting back home.

rJPIRYX4taxWrH-cssSrpg.text: I would go back to London just for this! The breakfast is a must with a good strong cup of tea. This place opens early and it caters to a mix of people from construction workers to businessmen.
